◆ CalibrationType

enum CalibrationType
strong

Supported calibration types.

Enumerator
Bootstrap 

Choose this option if the component's calibration strategy is expected to yield a perfect match of model to market prices. For example, this can be achieved when calibrating an IR component to a series of co-terminal swaptions with given mean reversion speed and piecewise volatility function (alpha) where jump times coincide with expiry dates in the swaption basket. Similarly, when calibrating an FX component to a series of FX Options. The calibration routine will throw an exception if no perfect match is achieved.

BestFit 

Choose this if no perfect match like above can be expected, for example when an IR component with constant parameters is calibrated to a basket of swaptions. The calibration routine will consequently not throw an exception when the match is imperfect.

None 

No calibration

Definition at line 53 of file lgmdata.hpp.

53  {
54  /*! Choose this option if the component's calibration strategy is expected to
55  yield a perfect match of model to market prices. For example, this can be
56  achieved when calibrating an IR component to a series of co-terminal
57  swaptions with given mean reversion speed and piecewise volatility
58  function (alpha) where jump times coincide with expiry dates in the swaption
59  basket. Similarly, when calibrating an FX component to a series of FX Options.
60  The calibration routine will throw an exception if no perfect match is
61  achieved.
62  */
63  Bootstrap,
64  /*! Choose this if no perfect match like above can be expected, for example when
65  an IR component with constant parameters is calibrated to a basket of swaptions.
66  The calibration routine will consequently not throw an exception when the match
67  is imperfect.
68  */
69  BestFit,
70  /*! No calibration
71  */
72  None
73 };

◆ MarketContext

enum MarketContext
strong

Market configuration contexts. Note that there is only one pricing context. If several are needed (for different trade types, different collateral currencies etc.), several engine factories should be set up for each such portfolio subset.

Enumerator
irCalibration 
fxCalibration 
eqCalibration 
pricing 

Definition at line 60 of file enginefactory.hpp.

60 { irCalibration, fxCalibration, eqCalibration, pricing };

◆ extractTermFromId()

std::pair< std::string, std::string > extractTermFromId ( const std::string &  id)

Given an id of the form name-tenor, parse and return a pair of strings where the first element of the pair is the name and the second element is the tenor. A check is made that the tenor can be parsed as a QuantLib::Period. If the parse is not successful, the pair of strings that are returned are empty.

Definition at line 222 of file cdsvolcurveconfig.cpp.

222  {
223 
224  pair<string, string> result;
225 
226  // Attempt to parse suffix "-<tenor_string>" from id.
227  auto pos = id.find_last_of('-');
228  if (pos != string::npos && pos != id.size() - 1 && pos != 0) {
229  Period tmp;
230  string term = id.substr(pos + 1);
231  if (tryParse<Period>(id.substr(pos + 1), tmp, parsePeriod)) {
232  DLOG("Parsed term suffix, " << term << ", from id " << id);
233  result.first = id.substr(0, pos);
234  result.second = term;
235  } else {
236  DLOG("Could not convert suffix, " << term << ", from id " << id << " to term.");
237  }
238  } else {
239  DLOG("Could not parse a term suffix from id " << id);
240  }
241 
242  return result;
243 }

◆ indexNameLessThan()

bool indexNameLessThan ( const std::string &  index1,
const std::string &  index2 
)

Definition at line 224 of file correlationcurveconfig.cpp.

224  {
225  vector<string> tokens1;
226  boost::split(tokens1, index1, boost::is_any_of("-"));
227  vector<string> tokens2;
228  boost::split(tokens2, index2, boost::is_any_of("-"));
229 
230  QL_REQUIRE(tokens1.size() >= 2, "at least two tokens expected in " << index1);
231  QL_REQUIRE(tokens2.size() >= 2, "at least two tokens expected in " << index2);
232 
233  Size s1, s2;
234 
235  if (tokens1[1] == "CMS")
236  s1 = 4;
237  else if (tokens1[0] == "FX")
238  s1 = 2;
239  else if (tokens1[0] == "EQ")
240  s1 = 1;
241  else if (tokens1[0] == "COMM")
242  s1 = 0;
243  else
244  s1 = 3; // assume Ibor
245 
246  if (tokens2[1] == "CMS")
247  s2 = 4;
248  else if (tokens2[0] == "FX")
249  s2 = 2;
250  else if (tokens2[0] == "EQ")
251  s2 = 1;
252  else if (tokens2[0] == "COMM")
253  s2 = 0;
254  else
255  s2 = 3; // assume Ibor
256 
257  if (s1 < s2)
258  return true;
259  else if (s2 < s1)
260  return false;
261 
262  // both EQ or both COM
263  if (s1 == 0 || s1 == 1)
264  return tokens1[1] < tokens2[1];
265 
266  QL_REQUIRE(tokens1.size() >= 3, "at least three tokens expected in " << index1)
267  QL_REQUIRE(tokens2.size() >= 3, "at least three tokens expected in " << index2)
268 
269  // both CMS or both Ibor, tenor is the last token (3rd or even 4th for customised CMS indices)
270  if (s1 == 3 || s1 == 4)
271  return parsePeriod(tokens1.back()) < parsePeriod(tokens2.back());
272 
273  QL_REQUIRE(tokens1.size() >= 4, "at least four tokens expected in " << index1)
274  QL_REQUIRE(tokens2.size() >= 4, "at least four tokens expected in " << index2)
275 
276  // both FX, compare CCY1 then CCY2 alphabetical
277  if (s1 == 2) {
278  return (tokens1[2] + "-" + tokens1[3]) < (tokens2[2] + "-" + tokens2[3]);
279  }
280 
281  QL_FAIL("indexNameLessThan(): internal error");
282 }
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ canBuild() [1/2]

bool ore::data::canBuild ( boost::shared_ptr< CurveSpec > &  spec,
vector< boost::shared_ptr< YieldCurveSpec >> &  yieldSpecs,
vector< boost::shared_ptr< CurveSpec >> &  commoditySpecs,
const CurveConfigurations &  curveConfigs,
map< string, string > &  missingDependents,
map< string, string > &  errors,
bool  continueOnError 
)

Definition at line 36 of file curveloader.cpp.

38  {
39 
40  // Check if we have the commodity curve configuration for the current commodity curve spec
41  string curveId = spec->curveConfigID();
42  if (!curveConfigs.hasCommodityCurveConfig(curveId)) {
43  string errMsg = "Can't get commodity curve configuration for curve " + curveId;
44  if (continueOnError) {
45  errors[spec->name()] = errMsg;
46  TLOG(errMsg);
47  return false;
48  } else {
49  QL_FAIL(errMsg);
50  }
51  }
52 
53  // Get the commodity curve configuration
54  boost::shared_ptr<CommodityCurveConfig> curveConfig = curveConfigs.commodityCurveConfig(curveId);
55 
56  // If it is direct, we can build it so just return true
57  if (curveConfig->type() == CommodityCurveConfig::Type::Direct) {
58  missingDependents[curveId] = "";
59  return true;
60  }
61 
62  // If it is cross currency type, need to check the two yield curves.
63  if (curveConfig->type() == CommodityCurveConfig::Type::CrossCurrency) {
64 
65  // 1. check if we have the base yield curve
66  auto ycIt =
67  find_if(yieldSpecs.begin(), yieldSpecs.end(), [&curveConfig](const boost::shared_ptr<YieldCurveSpec>& ycs) {
68  return ycs->curveConfigID() == curveConfig->baseYieldCurveId();
69  });
70  if (ycIt == yieldSpecs.end()) {
71  DLOG("Required yield curve " << curveConfig->baseYieldCurveId() << " for " << curveId << " not available");
72  missingDependents[curveId] = curveConfig->baseYieldCurveId();
73  return false;
74  }
75 
76  // 2. check if we have the commodity curve currency yield curve
77  ycIt =
78  find_if(yieldSpecs.begin(), yieldSpecs.end(), [&curveConfig](const boost::shared_ptr<YieldCurveSpec>& ycs) {
79  return ycs->curveConfigID() == curveConfig->yieldCurveId();
80  });
81  if (ycIt == yieldSpecs.end()) {
82  DLOG("Required yield curve " << curveConfig->yieldCurveId() << " for " << curveId << " not available");
83  missingDependents[curveId] = curveConfig->yieldCurveId();
84  return false;
85  }
86  }
87 
88  // If it is cross currency or basis type, need to check the base price curve.
89 
90  // 3. check if we already have the base commodity curve
91  auto it =
92  find_if(commoditySpecs.begin(), commoditySpecs.end(), [&curveConfig](const boost::shared_ptr<CurveSpec>& cs) {
93  return cs->curveConfigID() == curveConfig->basePriceCurveId();
94  });
95  if (it == commoditySpecs.end()) {
96  DLOG("Required commodity curve " << curveConfig->basePriceCurveId() << " for " << curveId << " not available");
97  missingDependents[curveId] = curveConfig->basePriceCurveId();
98  return false;
99  }
100 
101  // If we get here, we have a non-direct curve and we can build everything required
102  missingDependents[curveId] = "";
103  return true;
104 }

◆ canBuild() [2/2]

bool ore::data::canBuild ( boost::shared_ptr< CurveSpec > &  spec,
vector< boost::shared_ptr< CurveSpec >> &  cvSpecs,
const CurveConfigurations &  curveConfigs,
map< string, string > &  missingDependents,
map< string, string > &  errors,
bool  continueOnError 
)

Definition at line 108 of file curveloader.cpp.

110  {
111 
112  // Check if we have the commodity volatility curve configuration for the current commodity curve spec
113  string curveId = spec->curveConfigID();
114  if (!curveConfigs.hasCommodityVolatilityConfig(curveId)) {
115  string errMsg = "Can't get commodity volatility curve configuration for curve " + curveId;
116  if (continueOnError) {
117  errors[spec->name()] = errMsg;
118  TLOG(errMsg);
119  return false;
120  } else {
121  QL_FAIL(errMsg);
122  }
123  }
124 
125  // Get the commodity curve configuration
126  auto cvConfig = curveConfigs.commodityVolatilityConfig(curveId);
127 
128  // Currently, the only surface we have to check is the ApoFutureSurface as it is the only one that depends on
129  // another commodity volatility surface.
130  if (auto vapo = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<VolatilityApoFutureSurfaceConfig>(cvConfig->volatilityConfig())) {
131 
132  // The base volatility surface ID is in the form of a spec i.e. CommodityVolatility/<CCY>/<COMM_NAME>
133  auto vSpec = parseCurveSpec(vapo->baseVolatilityId());
134 
135  // Check if we already have the base commodity volatility surface.
136  auto it = find_if(cvSpecs.begin(), cvSpecs.end(), [&vSpec](const boost::shared_ptr<CurveSpec>& cs) {
137  return cs->curveConfigID() == vSpec->curveConfigID();
138  });
139 
140  if (it == cvSpecs.end()) {
141  DLOG("Required commodity volatility curve " << vSpec->curveConfigID() << " for " << curveId
142  << " not available");
143  missingDependents[curveId] = vSpec->curveConfigID();
144  return false;
145  }
146  }
147 
148  missingDependents[curveId] = "";
149  return true;
150 }

◆ orderCommodity()

void ore::data::orderCommodity ( vector< boost::shared_ptr< CurveSpec >> &  curveSpecs,
vector< boost::shared_ptr< YieldCurveSpec >> &  ycSpecs,
const CurveConfigurations &  curveConfigs,
map< string, string > &  errors,
bool  continueOnError 
)

Definition at line 154 of file curveloader.cpp.

156  {
157 
158  // Get iterator to the first commodity curve spec in curveSpecs, if there is one
159  auto firstCommIt = find_if(curveSpecs.begin(), curveSpecs.end(), [](const boost::shared_ptr<CurveSpec>& cs) {
160  return cs->baseType() == CurveSpec::CurveType::Commodity;
161  });
162 
163  // If no commodity curve specs, there is nothing to do
164  if (firstCommIt == curveSpecs.end())
165  return;
166 
167  // Get iterator to the last commodity curve spec in curveSpecs
168  auto lastCommRit = find_if(curveSpecs.rbegin(), curveSpecs.rend(), [](const boost::shared_ptr<CurveSpec>& cs) {
169  return cs->baseType() == CurveSpec::CurveType::Commodity;
170  });
171  auto lastCommIt = lastCommRit.base();
172 
173  // Remove the commodity curve specs from the curveSpecs for ordering
174  vector<boost::shared_ptr<CurveSpec>> commCurveSpecs(firstCommIt, lastCommIt);
175  firstCommIt = curveSpecs.erase(firstCommIt, lastCommIt);
176 
177  // Order the commodity curve specs in cvCurveSpecs
178  vector<boost::shared_ptr<CurveSpec>> orderedCommCurveSpecs;
179 
180  // Map to sort the missing dependencies
181  map<string, string> missingDependents;
182 
183  // Use same logic to populate orderedCvCurveSpecs as is used to populate sorted yield curve specs below
184  while (commCurveSpecs.size() > 0) {
185 
186  // Record size of commodity specs before checking if any of them can build
187  Size n = commCurveSpecs.size();
188 
189  // Check each curve remaining in cvCurveSpecs
190  auto it = commCurveSpecs.begin();
191  while (it != commCurveSpecs.end()) {
192  if (canBuild(*it, ycSpecs, orderedCommCurveSpecs, curveConfigs, missingDependents, errors,
193  continueOnError)) {
194  DLOG("Can build " << (*it)->curveConfigID());
195  orderedCommCurveSpecs.push_back(*it);
196  it = commCurveSpecs.erase(it);
197  } else {
198  DLOG("Cannot (yet) build " << (*it)->curveConfigID());
199  ++it;
200  }
201  }
202 
203  // If cvCurveSpecs has not been reduced in size after checking if any can build, we stop with error message
204  if (n == commCurveSpecs.size()) {
205  for (auto cs : commCurveSpecs) {
206  if (errors.count(cs->name()) > 0) {
207  WLOG("Cannot build curve " << cs->curveConfigID() << " due to error: " << errors.at(cs->name()));
208  } else {
209  WLOG("Cannot build curve " << cs->curveConfigID() << ", dependent curves missing");
210  errors[cs->name()] = "dependent curves missing - " + missingDependents[cs->curveConfigID()];
211  }
212  ALOG(StructuredCurveErrorMessage(cs->curveConfigID(), "Cannot build curve", errors.at(cs->name())));
213  }
214  break;
215  }
216  }
217 
218  // Insert the sorted commodity specs back at the correct location in the original curveSpecs
219  curveSpecs.insert(firstCommIt, orderedCommCurveSpecs.begin(), orderedCommCurveSpecs.end());
220 }

233  return cs->baseType() == CurveSpec::CurveType::CommodityVolatility;
234  });
235 
236  // If no commodity volatility curve specs, there is nothing to do
237  if (firstCommIt == curveSpecs.end())
238  return;
239 
240  // Get iterator to the last commodity volatility curve spec in curveSpecs
241  auto lastCommRit = find_if(curveSpecs.rbegin(), curveSpecs.rend(), [](const boost::shared_ptr<CurveSpec>& cs) {
242  return cs->baseType() == CurveSpec::CurveType::CommodityVolatility;
243  });
244  auto lastCommIt = lastCommRit.base();
245 
246  // Remove the commodity volatility curve specs from the curveSpecs for ordering
247  vector<boost::shared_ptr<CurveSpec>> cvCurveSpecs(firstCommIt, lastCommIt);
248  firstCommIt = curveSpecs.erase(firstCommIt, lastCommIt);
249

251  vector<boost::shared_ptr<CurveSpec>> orderedCvCurveSpecs;
252 
253  // Map to sort the missing dependencies
254  map<string, string> missingDependents;
255

257  while (cvCurveSpecs.size() > 0) {
258 
259  // Record size of commodity volatility curve specs before checking if any of them can build
260  Size n = cvCurveSpecs.size();
261 
262  // Check each curve remaining in cvCurveSpecs
263  auto it = cvCurveSpecs.begin();
264  while (it != cvCurveSpecs.end()) {
265  if (canBuild(*it, orderedCvCurveSpecs, curveConfigs, missingDependents, errors, continueOnError)) {
266  DLOG("Can build " << (*it)->curveConfigID());
267  orderedCvCurveSpecs.push_back(*it);
268  it = cvCurveSpecs.erase(it);
269  } else {
270  DLOG("Cannot (yet) build " << (*it)->curveConfigID());
271  ++it;
272  }
273  }
274 
275  // If cvCurveSpecs has not been reduced in size after checking if any can build, we stop with error message
276  if (n == cvCurveSpecs.size()) {
277  for (auto cs : cvCurveSpecs) {
278  if (errors.count(cs->name()) > 0) {
279  WLOG("Cannot build curve " << cs->curveConfigID() << " due to error: " << errors.at(cs->name()));
280  } else {
281  WLOG("Cannot build curve " << cs->curveConfigID() << ", dependent curves missing");
282  errors[cs->name()] = "dependent curves missing - " + missingDependents[cs->curveConfigID()];
283  }
284  ALOG(StructuredCurveErrorMessage(cs->curveConfigID(), "Cannot build curve", errors.at(cs->name())));
285  }
286  break;
287  }
288  }
289 
290  // Insert the sorted commodity volatility specs back at the correct location in the original curveSpecs
291  curveSpecs.insert(firstCommIt, orderedCvCurveSpecs.begin(), orderedCvCurveSpecs.end());
292 }

◆ operator<() [2/6]

bool operator< ( const CurveSpec &  lhs,
const CurveSpec &  rhs 
)

Relational operators for CurveSpecs.

Definition at line 27 of file curvespec.cpp.

27  {
28  if (lhs == rhs) {
29  /* If CurveSpecs are equal (i.e. have same name), return false. */
30  return false;
31  } else if (lhs.baseType() != rhs.baseType()) {
32  /* If types are not the same, use the enum value for ordering along type.
33  * The enum order in the header file is deliberate, it ensures that FX comes before FXVol
34  * this property is used in data::order() (see curveloader.hpp)
35  */
36  return lhs.baseType() < rhs.baseType();
37  } else {
38  /* If types are the same and CurveSpecs are different, use default < for string */
39  return lhs.name() < rhs.name();
40  }
41 }

◆ getCorrelationTokens()

std::vector< std::string > getCorrelationTokens ( const std::string &  name)

Helper function to get the two tokens in a correlation name Index2:Index1.

Definition at line 34 of file dependencygraph.cpp.

34  {
35  // Look for & first as it avoids collisions with : which can be used in an index name
36  // if it is not there we fall back on the old behaviour
37  string delim;
38  if (name.find('&') != std::string::npos)
39  delim = "&";
40  else
41  delim = "/:";
42  vector<string> tokens;
43  boost::split(tokens, name, boost::is_any_of(delim));
44  QL_REQUIRE(tokens.size() == 2,
45  "invalid correlation name '" << name << "', expected Index2:Index1 or Index2/Index1 or Index2&Index1");
46  return tokens;
47 }

◆ applyFixings()

void applyFixings ( const vector< Fixing > &  fixings,
const boost::shared_ptr< data::Conventions > &  conventions 
)

Utility to write a vector of fixings in the QuantLib index manager's fixing history.

Definition at line 40 of file fixings.cpp.

40  {
41  Size count = 0;
42  map<string, boost::shared_ptr<Index>> cache;
43  cpu_timer timer;
44  boost::shared_ptr<Index> index;
45  for (auto& f : fixings) {
46  try {
47  auto it = cache.find(f.name);
48  if (it == cache.end()) {
49  index = parseIndex(f.name, conventions);
50  cache[f.name] = index;
51  } else {
52  index = it->second;
53  }
54  index->addFixing(f.date, f.fixing, true);
55  TLOG("Added fixing for " << f.name << " (" << io::iso_date(f.date) << ") value:" << f.fixing);
56  count++;
57  } catch (const std::exception& e) {
58  WLOG("Error during adding fixing for " << f.name << ": " << e.what());
59  }
60  }
61  timer.stop();
62  LOG("Added " << count << " of " << fixings.size() << " fixings in " << timer.format(default_places, "%w")
63  << " seconds");
64 }

545  // straight pair
546  auto tmpCorr = correlationCurves.find("Correlation/" + index1 + "&" + index2);
547  if (tmpCorr != correlationCurves.end()) {
548  return Handle<QuantExt::CorrelationTermStructure>(tmpCorr->second->corrTermStructure());
549  }
550  // inverse pair
551  tmpCorr = correlationCurves.find("Correlation/" + index2 + "&" + index1);
552  if (tmpCorr != correlationCurves.end()) {
553  return Handle<QuantExt::CorrelationTermStructure>(tmpCorr->second->corrTermStructure());

574  Handle<QuantExt::CorrelationTermStructure>(tmpCorr->second->corrTermStructure());
575  return Handle<QuantExt::CorrelationTermStructure>(
576  boost::make_shared<QuantExt::NegativeCorrelationTermStructure>(h));
577  }

581  Handle<QuantExt::CorrelationTermStructure>(tmpCorr->second->corrTermStructure());

583  boost::make_shared<QuantExt::NegativeCorrelationTermStructure>(h));
584  }
585  // both fx indices inverted
586  tmpCorr = correlationCurves.find("Correlation/" + inverseFxIndex(index1) + "&" + inverseFxIndex(index2));

588  return Handle<QuantExt::CorrelationTermStructure>(tmpCorr->second->corrTermStructure());

592  return Handle<QuantExt::CorrelationTermStructure>(tmpCorr->second->corrTermStructure());
593  }
594 
595  QL_FAIL("no correlation curve found for " << index1 << ":" << index2);
596 }

◆ getInflationSwapStart()

QuantLib::Date getInflationSwapStart ( const Date &  asof,
const InflationSwapConvention &  convention 
)

Given an asof and inflation swap convention, determine the start date of an inflation swap.

In general, this just returns the asof. If the convention has a publication roll and a publication schedule, the swap start date will be generated according to this schedule.

Definition at line 352 of file inflationcurve.cpp.

352  {
353 
354  using IPR = InflationSwapConvention::PublicationRoll;
355 
356  // If no roll schedule, just return (as of, convention's obs lag).
357  if (conv.publicationRoll() == IPR::None) {
358  return asof;
359  }
360 
361  // Get schedule and check not empty
362  const Schedule& ps = conv.publicationSchedule();
363  QL_REQUIRE(!ps.empty(), "InflationCurve: roll on publication is true for " << conv.id() <<
364  " but the publication schedule is empty.");
365 
366  // Check the schedule dates cover the as of date.
367  const vector<Date>& ds = ps.dates();
368  QL_REQUIRE(ds.front() < asof, "InflationCurve: first date in the publication schedule (" <<
369  io::iso_date(ds.front()) << ") should be before the as of date (" << io::iso_date(asof) << ").");
370  QL_REQUIRE(asof < ds.back(), "InflationCurve: last date in the publication schedule (" <<
371  io::iso_date(ds.back()) << ") should be after the as of date (" << io::iso_date(asof) << ").");
372 
373  // Find d such that d_- < asof <= d. If necessary, move to the next publication schedule date. We
374  // know that there is another date because asof < ds.back() is checked above.
375  auto it = lower_bound(ds.begin(), ds.end(), asof);
376  Date d = *it;
377  if (asof == d && conv.publicationRoll() == IPR::OnPublicationDate) {
378  d = *next(it);
379  }
380 
381  // Move d back availibility lag and the 15th of that month is the helper's start date.
382  // Note: the 15th of the month is specific to AU CPI. We may need to generalise later.
383  d -= conv.index()->availabilityLag();
384 
385  return Date(15, d.month(), d.year());
386 }
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ load()

void ore::data::load ( InMemoryLoader &  loader,
const vector< string > &  data,
bool  isMarket,
bool  implyTodaysFixings 
)

Definition at line 31 of file inmemoryloader.cpp.

31  {
32  LOG("MemoryLoader started");
33 
34  Date today = QuantLib::Settings::instance().evaluationDate();
35 
36  for (Size i = 0; i < data.size(); ++i) {
37  string line = data[i];
38  // skip blank and comment lines
39  if (line.size() > 0 && line[0] != '#') {
40  vector<string> tokens;
41  boost::trim(line);
42  boost::split(tokens, line, boost::is_any_of(",;\t "), boost::token_compress_on);
43 
44  // TODO: should we try, catch and log any invalid lines?
45  QL_REQUIRE(tokens.size() == 3, "Invalid MemoryLoader line, 3 tokens expected " << line);
46  Date date = parseDate(tokens[0]);
47  const string& key = tokens[1];
48  Real value = parseReal(tokens[2]);
49 
50  if (isMarket) {
51  // process market
52  // build market datum and add to map
53  try {
54  loader.add(date, key, value);
55  TLOG("Added MarketDatum " << key);
56  } catch (std::exception& e) {
57  WLOG("Failed to parse MarketDatum " << key << ": " << e.what());
58  }
59  } else {
60  // process fixings
61  if (date < today || (date == today && !implyTodaysFixings))
62  loader.addFixing(date, key, value);
63  }
64  }
65  }
66  LOG("MemoryLoader completed");
67 }
Here is the call graph for this function:
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ loadDataFromBuffers()

void loadDataFromBuffers ( InMemoryLoader &  loader,

)

Utility function for loading market quotes and fixings from an in memory csv buffer.

Parameters
loaderThe loader that will be populated
marketDataQuantLib::Date Key Value in a single std::string, separated by blanks, tabs, colons or commas

implyTodaysFixingsEnable/disable implying today's fixings

◆ operator<<() [13/46]

std::ostream & operator<< ( std::ostream &  out,
const MarketDatum::QuoteType &  type 
)

Definition at line 32 of file marketdatum.cpp.

32  {
33  switch (type) {
34  case MarketDatum::QuoteType::BASIS_SPREAD:
35  return out << "BASIS_SPREAD";
36  case MarketDatum::QuoteType::CREDIT_SPREAD:
37  return out << "CREDIT_SPREAD";
38  case MarketDatum::QuoteType::CONV_CREDIT_SPREAD:
39  return out << "CONV_CREDIT_SPREAD";
40  case MarketDatum::QuoteType::YIELD_SPREAD:
41  return out << "YIELD_SPREAD";
42  case MarketDatum::QuoteType::RATE:
43  return out << "RATE";
44  case MarketDatum::QuoteType::RATIO:
45  return out << "RATIO";
46  case MarketDatum::QuoteType::PRICE:
47  return out << "PRICE";
48  case MarketDatum::QuoteType::RATE_LNVOL:
49  return out << "RATE_LNVOL";
50  case MarketDatum::QuoteType::RATE_NVOL:
51  return out << "RATE_NVOL";
52  case MarketDatum::QuoteType::RATE_SLNVOL:
53  return out << "RATE_SLNVOL";
54  case MarketDatum::QuoteType::BASE_CORRELATION:
55  return out << "BASE_CORRELATION";
56  case MarketDatum::QuoteType::SHIFT:
57  return out << "SHIFT";
58  case MarketDatum::QuoteType::NONE:
59  return out << "NULL";
60  default:
61  return out << "?";
62  }
63 }

◆ parseBaseStrike()

boost::shared_ptr< BaseStrike > parseBaseStrike ( const string &  strStrike)

Parse a Strike from its string representation, strStrike.

Definition at line 262 of file strike.cpp.

262  {
263 
264  boost::shared_ptr<BaseStrike> strike;
265 
266  // Expect strStrike to either:
267  // 1. have a single token which means that we have an absolute strike, or
268  // 2. have multiple tokens beginning with one of DEL, ATM or MNY
269  vector<string> tokens;
270  boost::split(tokens, strStrike, boost::is_any_of("/"));
271 
272  if (tokens.size() == 1) {
273  strike = boost::make_shared<AbsoluteStrike>();
274  } else if (tokens[0] == "DEL") {
275  strike = boost::make_shared<DeltaStrike>();
276  } else if (tokens[0] == "ATM") {
277  strike = boost::make_shared<AtmStrike>();
278  } else if (tokens[0] == "MNY") {
279  strike = boost::make_shared<MoneynessStrike>();
280  } else {
281  QL_FAIL("Could not parse strike string '" << strStrike << "'.");
282  }
283 
284  strike->fromString(strStrike);
285 
286  return strike;
287 }
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ buildYieldCurve()

boost::shared_ptr< YieldTermStructure > buildYieldCurve ( const vector< Date > &  dates,
const vector< QuantLib::Real > &  rates,
const DayCounter &  dayCounter,
YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod  interpolationMethod 
)

Templated function to build a YieldTermStructure and apply interpolation methods to it.

Definition at line 98 of file yieldcurve.cpp.

100  {
101 
102  boost::shared_ptr<YieldTermStructure> yieldts;
103  switch (interpolationMethod) {
104  case YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::Linear:
105  yieldts.reset(new CurveType<QuantLib::Linear>(dates, rates, dayCounter, QuantLib::Linear()));
106  break;
107  case YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::LogLinear:
108  yieldts.reset(new CurveType<QuantLib::LogLinear>(dates, rates, dayCounter, QuantLib::LogLinear()));
109  break;
110  case YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::NaturalCubic:
111  yieldts.reset(new CurveType<QuantLib::Cubic>(dates, rates, dayCounter,
112  QuantLib::Cubic(CubicInterpolation::Kruger, true)));
113  break;
114  case YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::FinancialCubic:
115  yieldts.reset(new CurveType<QuantLib::Cubic>(dates, rates, dayCounter,
116  QuantLib::Cubic(CubicInterpolation::Kruger, true,
117  CubicInterpolation::SecondDerivative, 0.0,
118  CubicInterpolation::FirstDerivative)));
119  break;
120  case YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::ConvexMonotone:
121  yieldts.reset(new CurveType<QuantLib::ConvexMonotone>(dates, rates, dayCounter));
122  break;
123  case YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::Quadratic:
124  yieldts.reset(new CurveType<QuantExt::Quadratic>(dates, rates, dayCounter, QuantExt::Quadratic(1, 0, 1, 0, 1)));
125  break;
126  case YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::LogQuadratic:
127  yieldts.reset(
128  new CurveType<QuantExt::LogQuadratic>(dates, rates, dayCounter, QuantExt::LogQuadratic(1, 0, -1, 0, 1)));
129  break;
130  case YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::Hermite:
131  yieldts.reset(new CurveType<QuantLib::Cubic>(dates, rates, dayCounter, Cubic(CubicInterpolation::Parabolic)));
132  break;
133  case YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::CubicSpline:
134  yieldts.reset(new CurveType<QuantLib::Cubic>(dates, rates, dayCounter,
135  Cubic(CubicInterpolation::Spline, false,
136  CubicInterpolation::SecondDerivative, 0.0,
137  CubicInterpolation::SecondDerivative, 0.0)));
138  break;
139  default:
140  QL_FAIL("Interpolation method not recognised.");
141  }
142  return yieldts;
143 }

165  {
166  if (s == "Linear")
167  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::Linear;
168  else if (s == "LogLinear")

170  else if (s == "NaturalCubic")
171  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::NaturalCubic;

173  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::FinancialCubic;
174  else if (s == "ConvexMonotone")
175  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::ConvexMonotone;
176  else if (s == "ExponentialSplines")
177  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::ExponentialSplines;
178  else if (s == "Quadratic")
179  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::Quadratic;
180  else if (s == "LogQuadratic")
181  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::LogQuadratic;

183  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::Hermite;

186  else if (s == "NelsonSiegel")
187  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::NelsonSiegel;
188  else if (s == "Svensson")
189  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::Svensson;
190  else

◆ getCalibrationDetails() [1/6]

std::string getCalibrationDetails ( LgmCalibrationInfo &  info,
const std::vector< boost::shared_ptr< BlackCalibrationHelper >> &  basket,
const boost::shared_ptr< IrLgm1fParametrization > &  parametrization 
)

Definition at line 124 of file utilities.cpp.

126  {
127  std::ostringstream log;
128  log << std::right << std::setw(3) << "#" << std::setw(14) << "time" << std::setw(14) << "modelVol" << std::setw(14)
129  << "marketVol" << std::setw(14) << "(diff)" << std::setw(14) << "modelValue" << std::setw(14) << "marketValue"
130  << std::setw(14) << "(diff)" << std::setw(14) << "irlgm1fAlpha" << std::setw(14) << "irlgm1fKappa"
131  << std::setw(16) << "irlgm1fHwSigma\n";
132  Real t = 0.0, modelAlpha = 0.0, modelKappa = 0.0, modelHwSigma = 0.0;
133  info.lgmCalibrationData.clear();
134  for (Size j = 0; j < basket.size(); j++) {
135  Real modelValue = basket[j]->modelValue();
136  Real marketValue = basket[j]->marketValue();
137  Real valueDiff = modelValue - marketValue;
138  Volatility modelVol = 0, marketVol = 0, volDiff = 0;
139  boost::shared_ptr<SwaptionHelper> swaption = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<SwaptionHelper>(basket[j]);
140  if (swaption != nullptr && parametrization != nullptr) {
141  // report alpha, kappa at t_expiry^-
142  t = parametrization->termStructure()->timeFromReference(swaption->swaption()->exercise()->date(0));
143  modelAlpha = parametrization->alpha(t - 1E-4);
144  modelKappa = parametrization->kappa(t - 1E-4);
145  modelHwSigma = parametrization->hullWhiteSigma(t - 1E-4);
146  }
147  // TODO handle other calibration helpers, too (capfloor)
148  marketVol = basket[j]->volatility()->value();
149  modelVol = impliedVolatility(basket[j]);
150  volDiff = modelVol - marketVol;
151  log << std::setw(3) << j << std::setprecision(6) << std::setw(14) << t << std::setw(14) << modelVol
152  << std::setw(14) << marketVol << std::setw(14) << volDiff << std::setw(14) << modelValue << std::setw(14)
153  << marketValue << std::setw(14) << valueDiff << std::setw(14) << modelAlpha << std::setw(14) << modelKappa
154  << std::setw(16) << modelHwSigma << "\n";
155  info.lgmCalibrationData.push_back(
156  LgmCalibrationData{t, modelVol, marketVol, modelValue, marketValue, modelAlpha, modelKappa, modelHwSigma});
157  }
158  if (parametrization != nullptr) {
159  // report alpha, kappa at t_expiry^+ for last expiry
160  modelAlpha = parametrization->alpha(t + 1E-4);
161  modelKappa = parametrization->kappa(t + 1E-4);
162  modelHwSigma = parametrization->hullWhiteSigma(t + 1E-4);
163  }
164  log << "t >= " << t << ": irlgm1fAlpha = " << modelAlpha << " irlgm1fKappa = " << modelKappa
165  << " irlgm1fHwSigma = " << modelHwSigma << "\n";
166  return log.str();
167 }
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ getCalibrationDetails() [2/6]

std::string getCalibrationDetails ( const std::vector< boost::shared_ptr< BlackCalibrationHelper >> &  basket,
const boost::shared_ptr< FxBsParametrization > &  parametrization,
const boost::shared_ptr< IrLgm1fParametrization > &  domesticLgm 
)

Definition at line 169 of file utilities.cpp.

171  {
172  std::ostringstream log;
173  log << std::right << std::setw(3) << "#" << std::setw(14) << "time" << std::setw(14) << "modelVol" << std::setw(14)
174  << "marketVol" << std::setw(14) << "(diff)" << std::setw(14) << "modelValue" << std::setw(14) << "marketValue"
175  << std::setw(14) << "(diff)" << std::setw(14) << "fxbsSigma\n";
176  Real t = 0.0, modelSigma = 0.0;
177  for (Size j = 0; j < basket.size(); j++) {
178  Real modelValue = basket[j]->modelValue();
179  Real marketValue = basket[j]->marketValue();
180  Real valueDiff = modelValue - marketValue;
181  Volatility modelVol = 0, marketVol = 0, volDiff = 0;
182  boost::shared_ptr<FxEqOptionHelper> fxoption = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<FxEqOptionHelper>(basket[j]);

184  // report alpha, kappa at t_expiry^-
185  t = domesticLgm->termStructure()->timeFromReference(fxoption->option()->exercise()->date(0));
186  modelSigma = parametrization->sigma(t - 1E-4);
187  }
188  marketVol = basket[j]->volatility()->value();
189  modelVol = impliedVolatility(basket[j]);
190  volDiff = modelVol - marketVol;
191  log << std::setw(3) << j << std::setprecision(6) << std::setw(14) << t << std::setw(14) << modelVol
192  << std::setw(14) << marketVol << std::setw(14) << volDiff << std::setw(14) << modelValue << std::setw(14)
193  << marketValue << std::setw(14) << valueDiff << std::setw(14) << modelSigma << "\n";
194  }
195  if (parametrization != nullptr) {
196  // report alpha, kappa at t_expiry^+ for last expiry
197  modelSigma = parametrization->sigma(t + 1E-4);
198  }
199  log << "t >= " << t << ": fxbsSigma = " << modelSigma << "\n";
200  return log.str();
201 }

◆ getCalibrationDetails() [3/6]

std::string getCalibrationDetails ( const std::vector< boost::shared_ptr< BlackCalibrationHelper >> &  basket,
const boost::shared_ptr< EqBsParametrization > &  parametrization,
const boost::shared_ptr< IrLgm1fParametrization > &  domesticLgm 
)

205  {
206  std::ostringstream log;
207  log << std::right << std::setw(3) << "#" << std::setw(14) << "time" << std::setw(14) << "modelVol" << std::setw(14)
208  << "marketVol" << std::setw(14) << "(diff)" << std::setw(14) << "modelValue" << std::setw(14) << "marketValue"
209  << std::setw(14) << "(diff)" << std::setw(14) << "eqbsSigma\n";
210  Real t = 0.0, modelSigma = 0.0;
211  for (Size j = 0; j < basket.size(); j++) {
212  Real modelValue = basket[j]->modelValue();
213  Real marketValue = basket[j]->marketValue();
214  Real valueDiff = modelValue - marketValue;
215  Volatility modelVol = 0, marketVol = 0, volDiff = 0;
216  boost::shared_ptr<FxEqOptionHelper> eqoption = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<FxEqOptionHelper>(basket[j]);
217  if (eqoption != nullptr && parametrization != nullptr && domesticLgm != nullptr) {
218  t = domesticLgm->termStructure()->timeFromReference(eqoption->option()->exercise()->date(0));
219  modelSigma = parametrization->sigma(t - 1E-4);
220  }
221  marketVol = basket[j]->volatility()->value();
222  modelVol = impliedVolatility(basket[j]);
223  volDiff = modelVol - marketVol;
224  log << std::setw(3) << j << std::setprecision(6) << std::setw(14) << t << std::setw(14) << modelVol
225  << std::setw(14) << marketVol << std::setw(14) << volDiff << std::setw(14) << modelValue << std::setw(14)
226  << marketValue << std::setw(14) << valueDiff << std::setw(14) << modelSigma << "\n";
227  }
228  if (parametrization != nullptr) {
229  modelSigma = parametrization->sigma(t + 1E-4);
230  }
231  log << "t >= " << t << ": eqbsSigma = " << modelSigma << "\n";
232  return log.str();
233 }

◆ getCalibrationDetails() [4/6]

std::string getCalibrationDetails ( const std::vector< boost::shared_ptr< BlackCalibrationHelper >> &  basket,
const boost::shared_ptr< InfDkParametrization > &  parametrization 
)

Definition at line 235 of file utilities.cpp.

236  {
237  std::ostringstream log;
238  log << std::right << std::setw(3) << "#" << std::setw(14) << "time" << std::setw(14) << "modelValue"
239  << std::setw(14) << "marketValue" << std::setw(14) << "(diff)" << std::setw(14) << "infdkAlpha" << std::setw(14)
240  << "infdkH\n";
241  Real t = 0.0, modelAlpha = 0.0, modelH = 0.0;
242  for (Size j = 0; j < basket.size(); j++) {
243  Real modelValue = basket[j]->modelValue();
244  Real marketValue = basket[j]->marketValue();
245  Real valueDiff = (modelValue - marketValue);
246  boost::shared_ptr<CpiCapFloorHelper> instr = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CpiCapFloorHelper>(basket[j]);
247  if (instr != nullptr && parametrization != nullptr) {
248  // report alpha, H at t_expiry^-
249  t = inflationYearFraction(
250  parametrization->termStructure()->frequency(), parametrization->termStructure()->indexIsInterpolated(),
251  parametrization->termStructure()->dayCounter(), parametrization->termStructure()->baseDate(),
252  instr->instrument()->payDate() - parametrization->termStructure()->observationLag());
253  modelAlpha = parametrization->alpha(t - 1.0 / 250.0);
254  modelH = parametrization->H(t - 1.0 / 250.0);
255  }
256  // TODO handle other calibration helpers, too (capfloor)
257  log << std::setw(3) << j << std::setprecision(6) << std::setw(14) << t << std::setw(14) << modelValue
258  << std::setw(14) << marketValue << std::setw(14) << valueDiff << std::setw(14) << modelAlpha
259  << std::setw(14) << modelH << "\n";
260  }
261  if (parametrization != nullptr) {
262  // report alpha, kappa at t_expiry^+ for last expiry
263  modelAlpha = parametrization->alpha(t + 1.0 / 250.0);
264  modelH = parametrization->H(t + 1.0 / 2500.0);
265  }
266  log << "t >= " << t << ": infDkAlpha = " << modelAlpha << " infDkH = " << modelH << "\n";
267  return log.str();
268 }

◆ getCalibrationDetails() [5/6]

std::string getCalibrationDetails ( const vector< boost::shared_ptr< CalibrationHelper >> &  rrBasket,
const vector< boost::shared_ptr< CalibrationHelper >> &  idxBasket,
const boost::shared_ptr< InfJyParameterization > &  p,
bool  calibrateRealRateVol 
)

Definition at line 270 of file utilities.cpp.

272  {
273 
274  ostringstream log;
275  Real epsTime = 0.0001;
276 
277  // Real rate basket: if it has instruments, the real rate was calibrated.
278  if (!rrBasket.empty()) {
279 
280  // Header rows
281  log << "Real rate calibration:\n";
282  log << right << setw(3) << "#" << setw(5) << "](-" << setw(12) << "inst_date" << setw(12) << "time" << setw(14)
283  << "modelValue" << setw(14) << "marketValue" << setw(14) << "(diff)" << setw(14) << "infJyAlpha" << setw(14)
284  << "infJyH\n";
285 
286  // Parameter values for corresponding to maturity of each instrument
287  Array times = calibrateRealRateVol ? p->realRate()->parameterTimes(0) : p->realRate()->parameterTimes(1);
288  auto helperValues = jyHelperValues(rrBasket, times);
289  Size ctr = 0;
290  Time t = 0.0;
291  for (const auto& kv : helperValues) {
292  auto hv = kv.second;
293  t = hv.maturity - epsTime;
294  string bound = "<=";
295  if (helperValues.size() == 1) {
296  bound = " -";
297  } else if (ctr == helperValues.size() - 1) {
298  t += 2 * epsTime;
299  bound = " >";
300  }
301  auto alpha = p->realRate()->alpha(t);
302  auto h = p->realRate()->H(t);
303  log << setw(3) << ctr++ << setw(5) << bound << setw(6) << io::iso_date(kv.first) << setprecision(6)
304  << setw(12) << hv.maturity << setw(14) << hv.modelValue << setw(14) << hv.marketValue << setw(14)
305  << hv.error << setw(14) << alpha << setw(14) << h << "\n";
306  }
307  }
308 
309  // Inflation index basket: if it has instruments, the inflation index was calibrated.
310  if (!idxBasket.empty()) {
311 
312  // Header rows
313  log << "Inflation index calibration:\n";
314  log << right << setw(3) << "#" << setw(5) << "](-" << setw(12) << "inst_date" << setw(12) << "time" << setw(14)
315  << "modelValue" << setw(14) << "marketValue" << setw(14) << "(diff)" << setw(14) << "infJySigma\n";
316 
317  // Parameter values for corresponding to maturity of each instrument
318  Array times = p->index()->parameterTimes(0);
319  auto helperValues = jyHelperValues(idxBasket, times);
320  Size ctr = 0;
321  Time t = 0.0;
322  for (const auto& kv : helperValues) {
323  auto hv = kv.second;
324  t = hv.maturity - epsTime;
325  string bound = "<=";
326  if (helperValues.size() == 1) {
327  bound = " -";
328  } else if (ctr == helperValues.size() - 1) {
329  t += 2 * epsTime;
330  bound = " >";
331  }
332  auto sigma = p->index()->sigma(t);
333  log << setw(3) << ctr++ << setw(5) << bound << setw(6) << io::iso_date(kv.first) << setprecision(6)
334  << setw(12) << hv.maturity << setw(14) << hv.modelValue << setw(14) << hv.marketValue << setw(14)
335  << hv.error << setw(14) << sigma << "\n";
336  }
337  }
338 
339  return log.str();
340 }

Populate bond data from name and ReferenceDataManager.

The following elements are references and updated, if empty: issuerId settlementDays calendar issueDate creditCurveId referenceCurveId proxySecurityId incomeCurveId volatilityCurveId coupons

Definition at line 12 of file bondutils.cpp.

16  {
17  DLOG("populating data bond from reference data");
18  QL_REQUIRE(bondRefData, "populateFromBondReferenceData(): empty bond reference datum given");
19  if (issuerId.empty()) {
20  issuerId = bondRefData->bondData().issuerId;
21  TLOG("overwrite issuerId with '" << issuerId << "'");
22  }
23  if (settlementDays.empty()) {
24  settlementDays = bondRefData->bondData().settlementDays;
25  TLOG("overwrite settlementDays with '" << settlementDays << "'");
26  }

28  calendar = bondRefData->bondData().calendar;
29  TLOG("overwrite calendar with '" << calendar << "'");
30  }

49  TLOG("overwrite incomeCurveId with '" << incomeCurveId << "'");
50  }
51  if (volatilityCurveId.empty()) {
52  volatilityCurveId = bondRefData->bondData().volatilityCurveId;
53  TLOG("overwrite volatilityCurveId with '" << volatilityCurveId << "'");
54  }
55  if (coupons.empty()) {
56  coupons = bondRefData->bondData().legData;
57  TLOG("overwrite coupons with " << coupons.size() << " LegData nodes");
58  }
59  DLOG("populating data bond from reference data done.");
60 }

◆ getOpenEndDateReplacement()

Date getOpenEndDateReplacement ( const std::string &  replacementPeriodStr,
const Calendar &  calendar 
)

Definition at line 62 of file bondutils.cpp.

62  {
63  if (replacementPeriodStr.empty())
64  return QuantLib::Null<QuantLib::Date>();
65  Date today = Settings::instance().evaluationDate();
66  Date result = Date::maxDate() - 365;
67  try {
68  // might throw because we are beyond the last allowed date
69  result = (calendar.empty() ? NullCalendar() : calendar).advance(today, parsePeriod(replacementPeriodStr));
70  } catch (...) {
71  }
72  DLOG("Compute open end date replacement as "
73  << QuantLib::io::iso_date(result) << " (today = " << QuantLib::io::iso_date(today)
74  << ", OpenEndDateReplacement from pricing engine config = " << replacementPeriodStr << ")");
75  return result;
76 }

◆ operator==() [5/7]

bool ore::data::operator== ( const CDSEngineKey &  lhs,
const CDSEngineKey &  rhs 
)

Definition at line 71 of file creditdefaultswap.hpp.

71  {
72 
73  // Check the credit curve IDs first
74  if (lhs.creditCurveId() != rhs.creditCurveId())
75  return false;
76 
77  // Check the currencies
78  if (lhs.currency() != rhs.currency())
79  return false;
80 
81  // Now check recovery rates.
82  if (lhs.recoveryRate() == QuantLib::Null<QuantLib::Real>() &&
83  rhs.recoveryRate() == QuantLib::Null<QuantLib::Real>()) {
84  // Most usual case is both are Null<Real> and using the recovery rate from the market.
85  return true;
86  } else if ((lhs.recoveryRate() != QuantLib::Null<QuantLib::Real>() &&
87  rhs.recoveryRate() == QuantLib::Null<QuantLib::Real>()) ||
88  (lhs.recoveryRate() == QuantLib::Null<QuantLib::Real>() &&
89  rhs.recoveryRate() != QuantLib::Null<QuantLib::Real>())) {
90  return false;
91  } else {
92  return QuantLib::close(lhs.recoveryRate(), rhs.recoveryRate());
93  }
94 }
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ operator<() [4/6]

bool ore::data::operator< ( const CDSEngineKey &  lhs,
const CDSEngineKey &  rhs 
)

Definition at line 96 of file creditdefaultswap.hpp.

96  {
97 
98  // Check equality first
99  if (lhs == rhs)
100  return false;
101 
102  // Now check credit curve Ids.
103  if (lhs.creditCurveId() != rhs.creditCurveId())
104  return lhs.creditCurveId() < rhs.creditCurveId();
105 
106  // Now check currencies.
107  if (lhs.currency() != rhs.currency())
108  return lhs.currency().name() < rhs.currency().name();
109 
110  // Now use the recovery rates
111  return lhs.recoveryRate() < rhs.recoveryRate();
112 }
Here is the call graph for this function:

109  return out << "XR14";
110  default:
111  QL_FAIL("Do not recognise CdsDocClause " << static_cast<int>(cdsDocClause));
112  }
113 }

)

127  {
128  vector<string> products = lhs.products();
129  // this assumes they are both sorted the same
130  if (products != rhs.products())
131  return false;
132  // now loop over the products and check everything
133  for (auto product : products) {
134  if (lhs.model(product) != rhs.model(product) || lhs.modelParameters(product) != rhs.modelParameters(product) ||
135  lhs.engine(product) != rhs.engine(product) ||
136  lhs.engineParameters(product) != rhs.engineParameters(product))
137  return false;
138  }
139  return true;
140 }

◆ amendInflationFixingDates() [1/2]

void ore::data::amendInflationFixingDates ( map< string, set< Date >> &  fixings,
const boost::shared_ptr< Conventions > &  conventions 
)

Definition at line 460 of file fixingdates.cpp.

460  {
461  // Loop over indices and amend any that are of type InflationIndex
462  for (auto& kv : fixings) {
463  auto p = isInflationIndex(kv.first, conventions);
464  if (p.first) {
465  // We have an inflation index
466  set<Date> newDates;
467  Frequency f = p.second->frequency();
468  for (const Date& d : kv.second) {
469  auto period = inflationPeriod(d, f);
470  if (d == period.first) {
471  // If the fixing date is the start of the inflation period, move it to the end.
472  newDates.insert(period.second);
473  } else {
474  // If the fixing date is not the start of the inflation period, leave it as it is.
475  newDates.insert(d);
476  }
477  }
478  // Update the fixings map that was passed in with the new set of dates
479  kv.second = newDates;
480  }
481  }
482 }

◆ addMarketFixingDates() [1/2]

void ore::data::addMarketFixingDates ( map< string, set< Date >> &  fixings,
const TodaysMarketParameters &  mktParams,
const Conventions &  conventions,
const Period &  iborLookback,
const Period &  oisLookback,
const Period &  bmaLookback,
const Period &  inflationLookback,
const string &  configuration 
)

Definition at line 484 of file fixingdates.cpp.

486  {
487 
488  if (mktParams.hasConfiguration(configuration)) {
489 
490  LOG("Start adding market fixing dates for configuration '" << configuration << "'");
491 
492  // If there are ibor indices in the market parameters, add the lookback fixings
493  // IF there are SIFMA / BMA indices, add lookback fixings for the Libor basis index
494  if (mktParams.hasMarketObject(MarketObject::IndexCurve)) {
495 
496  QL_REQUIRE(iborLookback >= 0 * Days, "Ibor lookback period must be non-negative");
497 
498  DLOG("Start adding market fixing dates for interest rate indices.");
499 
500  set<Date> iborDates;
501  set<Date> oisDates;
502  set<Date> bmaDates;
503  WeekendsOnly calendar;
504 
505  // For each of the IR indices in market parameters, insert the dates
506  for (const auto& kv : mktParams.mapping(MarketObject::IndexCurve, configuration)) {
507  if (isOvernightIndex(kv.first)) {
508  if (oisDates.empty()) {
509  TLOG("Generating fixing dates for overnight indices.");
510  oisDates = generateLookbackDates(oisLookback, calendar);
511  }
512  TLOG("Adding extra fixing dates for overnight index " << kv.first);
513  fixings[kv.first].insert(oisDates.begin(), oisDates.end());
514  } else if (isBmaIndex(kv.first)) {
515  if (bmaDates.empty()) {
516  TLOG("Generating fixing dates for bma/sifma indices.");
517  bmaDates = generateLookbackDates(bmaLookback, calendar);
518  }
519  fixings[kv.first].insert(bmaDates.begin(), bmaDates.end());
520  if (iborDates.empty()) {
521  TLOG("Generating fixing dates for ibor indices.");
522  iborDates = generateLookbackDates(iborLookback, calendar);
523  }
524  std::set<string> liborNames;
525  for (auto const& c : conventions.get(Convention::Type::BMABasisSwap)) {
526  auto bma = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<BMABasisSwapConvention>(c);
527  QL_REQUIRE(
528  bma, "internal error, could not cast to BMABasisSwapConvention in addMarketFixingDates()");
529  if (bma->bmaIndexName() == kv.first) {
530  liborNames.insert(bma->liborIndexName());
531  }
532  }
533  for (auto const& l : liborNames) {
534  TLOG("Adding extra fixing dates for libor index " << l << " from bma/sifma index " << kv.first);
535  fixings[l].insert(iborDates.begin(), iborDates.end());
536  }
537  } else {
538  if (iborDates.empty()) {
539  TLOG("Generating fixing dates for ibor indices.");
540  iborDates = generateLookbackDates(iborLookback, calendar);
541  }
542  TLOG("Adding extra fixing dates for ibor index " << kv.first);
543  fixings[kv.first].insert(iborDates.begin(), iborDates.end());
544  }
545  }
546 
547  DLOG("Finished adding market fixing dates for interest rate indices.");
548  }
549 
550  // If there are inflation indices in the market parameters, add the lookback fixings
551  if (mktParams.hasMarketObject(MarketObject::ZeroInflationCurve) ||
552  mktParams.hasMarketObject(MarketObject::YoYInflationCurve)) {
553 
554  QL_REQUIRE(inflationLookback >= 0 * Days, "Inflation lookback period must be non-negative");
555 
556  // Dates that will be used for each of the inflation indices
557  Date today = Settings::instance().evaluationDate();
558  Date lookback = NullCalendar().advance(today, -inflationLookback);
559  lookback = Date(1, lookback.month(), lookback.year());
560  set<Date> dates;
561  do {
562  TLOG("Adding date " << io::iso_date(lookback) << " to fixings for inflation indices");
563  dates.insert(lookback);
564  lookback = NullCalendar().advance(lookback, 1 * Months);
565  } while (lookback <= today);
566 
567  // For each of the inflation indices in market parameters, insert the dates
568  if (mktParams.hasMarketObject(MarketObject::ZeroInflationCurve)) {
569  for (const auto& kv : mktParams.mapping(MarketObject::ZeroInflationCurve, configuration)) {
570  TLOG("Adding extra fixing dates for (zero) inflation index " << kv.first);
571  fixings[kv.first].insert(dates.begin(), dates.end());
572  }
573  }
574 
575  if (mktParams.hasMarketObject(MarketObject::YoYInflationCurve)) {
576  for (const auto& kv : mktParams.mapping(MarketObject::YoYInflationCurve, configuration)) {
577  TLOG("Adding extra fixing dates for (yoy) inflation index " << kv.first);
578  fixings[kv.first].insert(dates.begin(), dates.end());
579  }
580  }
581  }
582 
583  // If there are commodity curves, add "fixings" for this month and two previous months. We add "fixings" for
584  // future contracts with expiry from two months hence to two months prior.
585  if (mktParams.hasMarketObject(MarketObject::CommodityCurve)) {
586 
587  // "Fixing" dates for commodities.
588  Period commodityLookback = 2 * Months;
589  Date today = Settings::instance().evaluationDate();
590  Date lookback = today - commodityLookback;
591  lookback = Date(1, lookback.month(), lookback.year());
592  set<Date> dates;
593  do {
594  TLOG("Adding date " << io::iso_date(lookback) << " to fixings for commodities");
595  dates.insert(lookback++);
596  } while (lookback <= today);
597 
598  // Expiry months and years for which we require future contract fixings. For our purposes here, using the
599  // 1st of the month does not matter. We will just use the date to get the appropriate commodity future
600  // index name below when adding the dates and the "-01" will be removed (for non-daily contracts).
601  Size numberMonths = 2;
602  vector<Date> contractExpiries;
603  Date startContract = today - numberMonths * Months;
604  Date endContract = today + numberMonths * Months;
605  do {
606  Month m = startContract.month();
607  Year y = startContract.year();
608  TLOG("Adding contract month and year (" << m << "," << y << ")");
609  contractExpiries.push_back(Date(1, m, y));
610  startContract += 1 * Months;
611  } while (startContract <= endContract);
612 
613  // For each of the commodity names, create the future contract name with the relevant expiry and insert
614  // the dates. Skip commodity names that do not have future conventions.
615  for (const auto& kv : mktParams.mapping(MarketObject::CommodityCurve, configuration)) {
616 
617  boost::shared_ptr<CommodityFutureConvention> cfc;
618  if (conventions.has(kv.first)) {
619  cfc = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CommodityFutureConvention>(conventions.get(kv.first));
620  }
621 
622  auto commIdx = parseCommodityIndex(kv.first, conventions, false);
623  if (cfc) {
624  if (auto oppIdx = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<OffPeakPowerIndex>(commIdx)) {
625  DLOG("Commodity " << kv.first << " is off-peak power so adding underlying daily contracts.");
626  const auto& opIndex = oppIdx->offPeakIndex();
627  const auto& pIndex = oppIdx->peakIndex();
628  for (const Date& expiry : dates) {
629  auto tmpIdx = oppIdx->clone(expiry);
630  auto opName = opIndex->clone(expiry)->name();
631  TLOG("Adding (date, id) = (" << io::iso_date(expiry) << "," << opName << ")");
632  fixings[opName].insert(expiry);
633  auto pName = pIndex->clone(expiry)->name();
634  TLOG("Adding (date, id) = (" << io::iso_date(expiry) << "," << pName << ")");
635  fixings[pName].insert(expiry);
636  }
637  } else if (cfc->contractFrequency() == Daily) {
638  DLOG("Commodity " << kv.first << " has daily frequency so adding daily contracts.");
639  for (const Date& expiry : dates) {
640  auto indexName = commIdx->clone(expiry)->name();
641  TLOG("Adding (date, id) = (" << io::iso_date(expiry) << "," << indexName << ")");
642  fixings[indexName].insert(expiry);
643  }
644  } else {
645  DLOG("Commodity " << kv.first << " is not daily so adding the monthly contracts.");
646  for (const Date& expiry : contractExpiries) {
647  auto indexName = commIdx->clone(expiry)->name();
648  TLOG("Adding extra fixing dates for commodity future " << indexName);
649  fixings[indexName].insert(dates.begin(), dates.end());
650  }
651  }
652  } else {
653  // Assumption here is that we have a spot index.
654  DLOG("Commodity " << kv.first << " does not have future conventions so adding daily fixings.");
655  auto indexName = commIdx->name();
656  TLOG("Adding extra fixing dates for commodity spot " << indexName);
657  fixings[indexName].insert(dates.begin(), dates.end());
658  }
659  }
660  }
661 
662  LOG("Finished adding market fixing dates for configuration '" << configuration << "'");
663  }
664 }
Here is the call graph for this function:
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ amendInflationFixingDates() [2/2]

void ore::data::amendInflationFixingDates ( std::map< std::string, std::set< QuantLib::Date >> &  fixings,
const boost::shared_ptr< Conventions > &  conventions = nullptr 
)

Inflation fixings are generally available on a monthly, or coarser, frequency. When a portfolio is asked for its fixings, and it contains inflation fixings, ORE will by convention put the fixing date as the 1st day of the applicable inflation period. Some market data providers by convention supply the inflation fixings with the date as the last date of the applicable inflation period. This function scans the fixings map, and moves any inflation fixing dates from the 1st day of the inflation period to the last day of the inflation period. The key in the fixings map is the index name and the value is the set of dates for which we require the fixings.

If inflation indices have been set up via ZeroInflationIndex entries in the Conventions, the conventions should be passed here. If not, the default nullptr parameter will be sufficient.

◆ addMarketFixingDates() [2/2]

void ore::data::addMarketFixingDates ( std::map< std::string, std::set< QuantLib::Date >> &  fixings,
const TodaysMarketParameters &  mktParams,
const Conventions &  conventions,
const QuantLib::Period &  iborLookback = 5 *QuantLib::Days,
const QuantLib::Period &  oisLookback = 4 *QuantLib::Months,
const QuantLib::Period &  bmaLookback = 2 *QuantLib::Weeks,
const QuantLib::Period &  inflationLookback = 1 *QuantLib::Years,
const std::string &  configuration = Market::defaultConfiguration 
)

Add index and fixing date pairs to fixings that will be potentially needed to build a TodaysMarket.

These additional index and fixing date pairs are found by scanning the mktParams and:

  • for MarketObject::IndexCurve, take the ibor index name and add the dates for each weekday between settlement date minus iborLookback period or oisLookback period and settlement date. The distinction between Ibor and OIS is made here to cover the fixings necessary for OIS futures. The default value of 4 months covers OIS futures with a contract period of up to 3 months. It would need to be configured differently if OIS futures with a longer contract period are possible.
  • for MarketObject::ZeroInflationCurve, take the inflation index and add the first of each month between settlement date minus inflationLookback period and settlement date
  • for MarketObject::YoYInflationCurve, take the inflation index and add the first of each month between settlement date minus inflationLookback period and settlement date
  • for MarketObject::CommodityCurve, add fixings for future contracts expiring 2 months either side of the settlement date. The fixing dates are added for each weekday going back to the first day of the month that precedes the settlement date by 2 months. The approach here will give rise to some spot commodities being given a future contract name and dates added against them - this should not be a problem as there will be no fixings found for them in any case.

The original fixings map may be empty.

◆ lessThan()

bool ore::data::lessThan ( const string &  s1,
const string &  s2 
)

Definition at line 79 of file legdata.cpp.

79 { return s1 < s2; }
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ makeZCFixedLeg()

Leg makeZCFixedLeg ( const LegData &  data,
const QuantLib::Date &  openEndDateReplacement 
)

Definition at line 857 of file legdata.cpp.

857  {
858  boost::shared_ptr<ZeroCouponFixedLegData> zcFixedLegData =
859  boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<ZeroCouponFixedLegData>(data.concreteLegData());
860  QL_REQUIRE(zcFixedLegData, "Wrong LegType, expected Zero Coupon Fixed, got " << data.legType());
861 
862  Schedule schedule = makeSchedule(data.schedule(), openEndDateReplacement);
863  DayCounter dc = parseDayCounter(data.dayCounter());
864  BusinessDayConvention bdc = parseBusinessDayConvention(data.paymentConvention());
865  // check we have a single notional and two dates in the schedule
866  Size numNotionals = data.notionals().size();
867  Size numRates = zcFixedLegData->rates().size();
868  Size numDates = schedule.size();
869  QL_REQUIRE(numDates >= 2, "Incorrect number of schedule dates entered, expected at least 2, got " << numDates);
870  QL_REQUIRE(numNotionals >= 1, "Incorrect number of notional values entered, expected at least1, got " << numNotionals);
871  QL_REQUIRE(numRates >= 1, "Incorrect number of rate values entered, expected at least 1, got " << numRates);
872 
873 
874  vector<Date> dates = schedule.dates();
875 
876  vector<double> rates = buildScheduledVector(zcFixedLegData->rates(), zcFixedLegData->rateDates(), schedule);
877  vector<double> notionals = buildScheduledVector(data.notionals(), data.notionalDates(), schedule);
878 
879  Compounding comp = parseCompounding(zcFixedLegData->compounding());
880  QL_REQUIRE(comp == QuantLib::Compounded || comp == QuantLib::Simple,
881  "Compounding method " << zcFixedLegData->compounding() << " not supported");
882 
883  // we loop over the dates in the schedule, computing the compound factor.
884  // For the Compounded rule:
885  // (1+r)^dcf_0 * (1+r)^dcf_1 * ... = (1+r)^(dcf_0 + dcf_1 + ...)
886  // So we compute the sum of all DayCountFractions in the loop.
887  // For the Simple rule:
888  // (1 + r * dcf_0) * (1 + r * dcf_1)...
889  double totalDCF = 0;
890  double compoundFactor = 1;
891  Leg leg;
892  for (Size i = 0; i < numDates - 1; i++) {
893  double dcf = dc.yearFraction(dates[i], dates[i + 1]);
894  double fixedAmount = i < notionals.size() ? notionals[i] : notionals.back();
895  double fixedRate = i < rates.size() ? rates[i] : rates.back();
896  if (comp == QuantLib::Simple)
897  compoundFactor *= (1 + fixedRate * dcf);
898  else
899  totalDCF += dcf;
900  if (comp == QuantLib::Compounded)
901  compoundFactor = pow(1.0 + fixedRate, totalDCF);
902  if (zcFixedLegData->subtractNotional())
903  fixedAmount *= (compoundFactor - 1);
904  else
905  fixedAmount *= compoundFactor;
906  Date fixedPayDate = schedule.calendar().adjust(dates[i + 1], bdc);
907  leg.push_back(boost::shared_ptr<CashFlow>(new SimpleCashFlow(fixedAmount, fixedPayDate)));
908  }
909  return leg;
910 }
Here is the call graph for this function:
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ makeIborLeg()

Leg makeIborLeg ( const LegData &  data,

const boost::shared_ptr< EngineFactory > &  engineFactory,
const bool  attachPricer,
const QuantLib::Date &  openEndDateReplacement 
)

Definition at line 912 of file legdata.cpp.

914  {
915  boost::shared_ptr<FloatingLegData> floatData = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<FloatingLegData>(data.concreteLegData());
916  QL_REQUIRE(floatData, "Wrong LegType, expected Floating, got " << data.legType());
917 
918  Schedule schedule = makeSchedule(data.schedule(), openEndDateReplacement);
919  DayCounter dc = parseDayCounter(data.dayCounter());
920  BusinessDayConvention bdc = parseBusinessDayConvention(data.paymentConvention());
921 
922  bool hasCapsFloors = floatData->caps().size() > 0 || floatData->floors().size() > 0;
923  vector<double> notionals = buildScheduledVectorNormalised(data.notionals(), data.notionalDates(), schedule, 0.0);
924  vector<double> spreads =
925  buildScheduledVectorNormalised(floatData->spreads(), floatData->spreadDates(), schedule, 0.0);
926  vector<double> gearings =
927  buildScheduledVectorNormalised(floatData->gearings(), floatData->gearingDates(), schedule, 1.0);
928  Size fixingDays = floatData->fixingDays() == Null<Size>() ? index->fixingDays() : floatData->fixingDays();
929  bool isInArrears = floatData->isInArrears() ? *floatData->isInArrears() : false;
930 
931  applyAmortization(notionals, data, schedule, true);
932  // handle float annuity, which is not done in applyAmortization, for this we can only have one block
933  if (!data.amortizationData().empty()) {
934  AmortizationType amortizationType = parseAmortizationType(data.amortizationData().front().type());
935  if (amortizationType == AmortizationType::Annuity) {
936  LOG("Build floating annuity notional schedule");
937  QL_REQUIRE(!hasCapsFloors, "Caps/Floors not supported in floating annuity coupons");
938  QL_REQUIRE(floatData->gearings().size() == 0, "Gearings not supported in floating annuity coupons");
939  DayCounter dc = index->dayCounter();
940  Date startDate = parseDate(data.amortizationData().front().startDate());
941  double annuity = data.amortizationData().front().value();
942  bool underflow = data.amortizationData().front().underflow();
943  vector<boost::shared_ptr<Coupon>> coupons;
944  for (Size i = 0; i < schedule.size() - 1; i++) {
945  Date paymentDate = schedule.calendar().adjust(schedule[i + 1], bdc);
946  if (schedule[i] < startDate || i == 0) {
947  boost::shared_ptr<FloatingRateCoupon> coupon;
948  if (!floatData->hasSubPeriods()) {
949  coupon = boost::make_shared<IborCoupon>(paymentDate, notionals[i], schedule[i], schedule[i + 1],
950  fixingDays, index, gearings[i], spreads[i], Date(),
951  Date(), dc, isInArrears);
952  coupon->setPricer(boost::make_shared<BlackIborCouponPricer>());
953  } else {
954  coupon = boost::make_shared<QuantExt::SubPeriodsCoupon1>(
955  paymentDate, notionals[i], schedule[i], schedule[i + 1], index,
956  floatData->isAveraged() ? QuantExt::SubPeriodsCoupon1::Averaging : QuantExt::SubPeriodsCoupon1::Compounding,
957  index->businessDayConvention(), spreads[i], dc, floatData->includeSpread(), gearings[i]);
958  coupon->setPricer(boost::make_shared<QuantExt::SubPeriodsCouponPricer1>());
959  }
960  coupons.push_back(coupon);
961  LOG("FloatingAnnuityCoupon: " << i << " " << coupon->nominal() << " " << coupon->amount());
962  } else {
963  QL_REQUIRE(coupons.size() > 0,
964  "FloatingAnnuityCoupon needs at least one predecessor, e.g. a plain IborCoupon");
965  LOG("FloatingAnnuityCoupon, previous nominal/coupon: " << i << " " << coupons.back()->nominal()
966  << " " << coupons.back()->amount());
967  boost::shared_ptr<QuantExt::FloatingAnnuityCoupon> coupon =
968  boost::make_shared<QuantExt::FloatingAnnuityCoupon>(
969  annuity, underflow, coupons.back(), paymentDate, schedule[i], schedule[i + 1], fixingDays,
970  index, gearings[i], spreads[i], Date(), Date(), dc, isInArrears);
971  coupons.push_back(coupon);
972  LOG("FloatingAnnuityCoupon: " << i << " " << coupon->nominal() << " " << coupon->amount());
973  }
974  }
975  Leg leg;
976  for (Size i = 0; i < coupons.size(); i++)
977  leg.push_back(coupons[i]);
978  LOG("Floating annuity notional schedule done");
979  return leg;
980  }
981  }
982 
983  if (floatData->hasSubPeriods()) {
984  QL_REQUIRE(floatData->caps().empty() && floatData->floors().empty(),
985  "SubPeriodsLegs does not support caps or floors");
986  QL_REQUIRE(!isInArrears, "SubPeriodLegs do not support in aarears fixings");
987  Leg leg = QuantExt::SubPeriodsLeg1(schedule, index)
988  .withNotionals(notionals)
989  .withPaymentDayCounter(dc)
990  .withPaymentAdjustment(bdc)
991  .withGearings(gearings)
992  .withSpreads(spreads)
993  .withType(floatData->isAveraged() ? QuantExt::SubPeriodsCoupon1::Averaging : QuantExt::SubPeriodsCoupon1::Compounding)
994  .includeSpread(floatData->includeSpread());
995  QuantExt::setCouponPricer(leg, boost::make_shared<QuantExt::SubPeriodsCouponPricer1>());
996  return leg;
997  }
998 
999  IborLeg iborLeg = IborLeg(schedule, index)
1000  .withNotionals(notionals)
1001  .withSpreads(spreads)
1002  .withPaymentDayCounter(dc)
1003  .withPaymentAdjustment(bdc)
1004  .withFixingDays(fixingDays)
1005  .inArrears(isInArrears)
1006  .withGearings(gearings)
1007  .withPaymentLag(data.paymentLag());
1008 
1009  // If no caps or floors or in arrears fixing, return the leg
1010  if (!hasCapsFloors && !isInArrears)
1011  return iborLeg;
1012 
1013  // If there are caps or floors or in arrears fixing, add them and set pricer
1014  if (floatData->caps().size() > 0)
1015  iborLeg.withCaps(buildScheduledVector(floatData->caps(), floatData->capDates(), schedule));
1016 
1017  if (floatData->floors().size() > 0)
1018  iborLeg.withFloors(buildScheduledVector(floatData->floors(), floatData->floorDates(), schedule));
1019 
1020  if (!attachPricer)
1021  return iborLeg;
1022 
1023  // Get a coupon pricer for the leg
1024  boost::shared_ptr<EngineBuilder> builder = engineFactory->builder("CapFlooredIborLeg");
1025  QL_REQUIRE(builder, "No builder found for CapFlooredIborLeg");
1026  boost::shared_ptr<CapFlooredIborLegEngineBuilder> cappedFlooredIborBuilder =
1027  boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CapFlooredIborLegEngineBuilder>(builder);
1028  boost::shared_ptr<FloatingRateCouponPricer> couponPricer = cappedFlooredIborBuilder->engine(index->currency());
1029 
1030  // Loop over the coupons in the leg and set pricer
1031  Leg tmpLeg = iborLeg;
1032  QuantLib::setCouponPricer(tmpLeg, couponPricer);
1033 
1034  // build naked option leg if required
1035  if (floatData->nakedOption()) {
1036  tmpLeg = StrippedCappedFlooredCouponLeg(tmpLeg);
1037  // fix for missing registration in ql 1.13
1038  for (auto const& t : tmpLeg) {
1039  auto s = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<StrippedCappedFlooredCoupon>(t);
1040  if (s != nullptr)
1041  s->registerWith(s->underlying());
1042  }
1043  }
1044  return tmpLeg;
1045 }

Definition at line 1181 of file legdata.cpp.

1182  {
1183 
1184  // Assumption - Cashflows on Input Leg are all coupons
1185  // This is the Leg to be populated
1186  Leg leg;
1187 
1188  // Initial Flow Amount
1189  if (initNomFlow) {
1190  auto coupon = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantLib::Coupon>(refLeg[0]);
1191  QL_REQUIRE(coupon, "makeNotionalLeg does not support non-coupon legs");
1192  double initFlowAmt = coupon->nominal();
1193  Date initDate = coupon->accrualStartDate();
1194  initDate = paymentCalendar.adjust(initDate, paymentConvention);
1195  if (initFlowAmt != 0)
1196  leg.push_back(boost::shared_ptr<CashFlow>(new SimpleCashFlow(-initFlowAmt, initDate)));
1197  }
1198 
1199  // Amortization Flows
1200  if (amortNomFlow) {
1201  for (Size i = 1; i < refLeg.size(); i++) {
1202  auto coupon = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantLib::Coupon>(refLeg[i]);
1203  QL_REQUIRE(coupon, "makeNotionalLeg does not support non-coupon legs");
1204  auto coupon2 = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantLib::Coupon>(refLeg[i - 1]);
1205  QL_REQUIRE(coupon, "makeNotionalLeg does not support non-coupon legs");
1206  Date flowDate = coupon->accrualStartDate();
1207  flowDate = paymentCalendar.adjust(flowDate, paymentConvention);
1208  Real initNom = coupon2->nominal();
1209  Real newNom = coupon->nominal();
1210  Real flow = initNom - newNom;
1211  if (flow != 0)
1212  leg.push_back(boost::shared_ptr<CashFlow>(new SimpleCashFlow(flow, flowDate)));
1213  }
1214  }
1215 
1216  // Final Nominal Return at Maturity
1217  if (finalNomFlow) {
1218  // boost::shared_ptr<QuantLib::Coupon> coupon = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantLib::Coupon>(refLeg.back());
1219  // if (coupon) {
1220  // double finalNomFlow = coupon->nominal();
1221  // Date finalDate = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantLib::Coupon>(refLeg.back())->date();
1222  // if (finalNomFlow != 0)
1223  // leg.push_back(boost::shared_ptr<CashFlow>(new SimpleCashFlow(finalNomFlow, finalDate)));
1224  // } else {
1225  // ALOG("The reference leg's last cash flow is not a coupon, we cannot create a final exchange flow");
1226  // }
1227  auto coupon = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantLib::Coupon>(refLeg.back());
1228  QL_REQUIRE(coupon, "makeNotionalLeg does not support non-coupon legs");
1229  double finalNomFlow = coupon->nominal();
1230  Date finalDate = coupon->accrualEndDate();
1231  finalDate = paymentCalendar.adjust(finalDate, paymentConvention);
1232  if (finalNomFlow != 0)
1233  leg.push_back(boost::shared_ptr<CashFlow>(new SimpleCashFlow(finalNomFlow, finalDate)));
1234  }
1235 
1236  return leg;
1237 }

1254  bool couponFloor = cpiLegData->floors().size() > 0;

1263  engineFactory->configuration(MarketContext::pricing)),

1273 
1274  // the cpi leg uses the first schedule date as the start date, which only makes sense if there are at least
1275  // two dates in the schedule, otherwise the only date in the schedule is the pay date of the cf and a a separate
1276  // start date is expected; if both the separate start date and a schedule with more than one date is given
1277  const string& start = cpiLegData->startDate();
1278  if (schedule.size() < 2) {
1279  QL_REQUIRE(!start.empty(), "makeCPILeg(): only one schedule date, a 'StartDate' must be given.");
1280  cpiLeg.withStartDate(parseDate(start));
1281  } else if (!start.empty()) {
1282  DLOG("Schedule with more than 2 dates was provided. The first schedule date "
1283  << io::iso_date(schedule.dates().front()) << " is used as the start date. The 'StartDate' of " << start
1284  << " is not used.");
1285  }

1288

1302  QL_REQUIRE(n > 0, "Empty CPI Leg");
1303 
1304  if (couponCapFloor || finalFlowCapFloor) {
1305

1307  // remove blanks (FIXME)
1308  indexName.replace(indexName.find(" ", 0), 1, "");
1309 
1310  // get a coupon pricer for the leg
1311  boost::shared_ptr<EngineBuilder> cpBuilder = engineFactory->builder("CappedFlooredCpiLegCoupons");
1312  QL_REQUIRE(cpBuilder, "No builder found for CappedFlooredCpiLegCoupons");
1313  boost::shared_ptr<CapFlooredCpiLegCouponEngineBuilder> cappedFlooredCpiCouponBuilder =
1314  boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CapFlooredCpiLegCouponEngineBuilder>(cpBuilder);
1315  boost::shared_ptr<InflationCouponPricer> couponPricer = cappedFlooredCpiCouponBuilder->engine(indexName);
1316 
1317  // get a cash flow pricer for the leg
1318  boost::shared_ptr<EngineBuilder> cfBuilder = engineFactory->builder("CappedFlooredCpiLegCashFlows");
1319  QL_REQUIRE(cfBuilder, "No builder found for CappedFlooredCpiLegCashFLows");
1320  boost::shared_ptr<CapFlooredCpiLegCashFlowEngineBuilder> cappedFlooredCpiCashFlowBuilder =
1321  boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CapFlooredCpiLegCashFlowEngineBuilder>(cfBuilder);
1322  boost::shared_ptr<InflationCashFlowPricer> cashFlowPricer = cappedFlooredCpiCashFlowBuilder->engine(indexName);
1323 
1324  // set coupon pricer for the leg
1325  for (Size i = 0; i < leg.size(); i++) {
1326  // nothing to do for the plain CPI Coupon, because the pricer is already set when the leg bilder is called
1327  // nothing to do for the plain CPI CashFlow either, because it does not require a pricer
1328 
1329  boost::shared_ptr<CappedFlooredCPICoupon> cfCpiCoupon =
1330  boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CappedFlooredCPICoupon>(leg[i]);
1331  if (cfCpiCoupon && couponCapFloor) {
1332  cfCpiCoupon->setPricer(couponPricer);
1333  }
1334 
1335  boost::shared_ptr<CappedFlooredCPICashFlow> cfCpiCashFlow =
1336  boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CappedFlooredCPICashFlow>(leg[i]);
1337  if (cfCpiCashFlow && finalFlowCapFloor && i == (leg.size()-1)) {
1338  cfCpiCashFlow->setPricer(cashFlowPricer);
1339  }
1340  }
1341  }
1342 
1343  // QuantLib CPILeg automatically adds a Notional Cashflow at maturity date on a CPI swap
1344  // If Notional Exchange set to false, remove the final cashflow.
1345  if (!data.notionalFinalExchange()) {
1346  // QL_REQUIRE(n > 1, "Cannot have Notional Final Exchange with just a single cashflow");
1347  // boost::shared_ptr<CPICashFlow> cpicf = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CPICashFlow>(leg[n - 1]);
1348  // We do not need this check that the last coupon payment date matches the final CPI cash flow date, this is
1349  // identical by construction, see QuantLib::CPILeg or QuantExt::CPILeg.
1350  // Moreover, we may have no coupons and just a single fow at the end so that leg[n - 2] causes a problem.
1351  // boost::shared_ptr<Coupon> coupon = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<Coupon>(leg[n - 2]);
1352  // if (cpicf && (cpicf->date() == coupon->date()))
1353  // leg.pop_back();
1354  leg.pop_back();
1355  }
1356 
1357  // build naked option leg if required and we have at least one cap/floor present in the coupon or the final flow
1358  if ((couponCapFloor || finalFlowCapFloor) && cpiLegData->nakedOption()) {
1359  leg = StrippedCappedFlooredCPICouponLeg(leg);
1360  }
1361 
1362  return leg;
1363 }
