1375  buildScheduledVectorNormalised(yoyLegData->gearings(), yoyLegData->gearingDates(), schedule, 1.0);
1376  vector<double> spreads =
1377  buildScheduledVectorNormalised(yoyLegData->spreads(), yoyLegData->spreadDates(), schedule, 0.0);
1378  vector<double> notionals = buildScheduledVector(data.notionals(), data.notionalDates(), schedule);
1379 
1380  bool irregularYoY = yoyLegData->irregularYoY();
1381  bool couponCap = yoyLegData->caps().size() > 0;
1382  bool couponFloor = yoyLegData->floors().size() > 0;
1383  bool couponCapFloor = yoyLegData->caps().size() > 0 || yoyLegData->floors().size() > 0;
1384  bool addInflationNotional = yoyLegData->addInflationNotional();
1385 
1386  applyAmortization(notionals, data, schedule, false);
1387  Leg leg;
1388  if (!irregularYoY) {
1389  auto yoyIndex = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<YoYInflationIndex>(index);
1390  QL_REQUIRE(yoyIndex, "Need a YoY Inflation Index");
1391  QuantExt::yoyInflationLeg yoyLeg =
1392  QuantExt::yoyInflationLeg(schedule, schedule.calendar(), yoyIndex, observationLag)
1393  .withNotionals(notionals)
1394  .withPaymentDayCounter(dc)
1395  .withPaymentAdjustment(bdc)
1396  .withFixingDays(yoyLegData->fixingDays())
1397  .withGearings(gearings)
1398  .withSpreads(spreads)
1399  .withInflationNotional(addInflationNotional)
1400  .withRateCurve(engineFactory->market()->discountCurve(
1401  data.currency(), engineFactory->configuration(MarketContext::pricing)));
1402 
1403  if (couponCap)
1404  yoyLeg.withCaps(buildScheduledVector(yoyLegData->caps(), yoyLegData->capDates(), schedule));
1405 
1406  if (couponFloor)
1407  yoyLeg.withFloors(buildScheduledVector(yoyLegData->floors(), yoyLegData->floorDates(), schedule));
1408 
1409  leg = yoyLeg.operator Leg();
1410 
1411  if (couponCapFloor) {
1412  // get a coupon pricer for the leg
1413  boost::shared_ptr<EngineBuilder> builder = engineFactory->builder("CapFlooredYYLeg");
1414  QL_REQUIRE(builder, "No builder found for CapFlooredYYLeg");
1415  boost::shared_ptr<CapFlooredYoYLegEngineBuilder> cappedFlooredYoYBuilder =
1416  boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CapFlooredYoYLegEngineBuilder>(builder);
1417  string indexname = yoyIndex->name();
1418  boost::shared_ptr<InflationCouponPricer> couponPricer =
1419  cappedFlooredYoYBuilder->engine(indexname.replace(indexname.find(" ", 0), 1, ""));
1420 
1421  // set coupon pricer for the leg
1422 
1423  for (Size i = 0; i < leg.size(); i++) {
1424  boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantExt::CappedFlooredYoYInflationCoupon>(leg[i])->setPricer(
1425  boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantLib::YoYInflationCouponPricer>(couponPricer));
1426  }
1427 
1428  // build naked option leg if required
1429  if (yoyLegData->nakedOption()) {
1430  leg = StrippedCappedFlooredYoYInflationCouponLeg(leg);
1431  for (auto const& t : leg) {
1432  auto s = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<StrippedCappedFlooredYoYInflationCoupon>(t);
1433  }
1434  }
1435  }
1436  } else {
1437 
1438  auto zcIndex = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<ZeroInflationIndex>(index);
1439  QL_REQUIRE(zcIndex, "Need a Zero Coupon Inflation Index");
1440  QuantExt::NonStandardYoYInflationLeg yoyLeg =
1441  QuantExt::NonStandardYoYInflationLeg(schedule, schedule.calendar(), zcIndex, observationLag)
1442  .withNotionals(notionals)
1443  .withPaymentDayCounter(dc)
1444  .withPaymentAdjustment(bdc)
1445  .withFixingDays(yoyLegData->fixingDays())
1446  .withGearings(gearings)
1447  .withSpreads(spreads)
1448  .withRateCurve(engineFactory->market()->discountCurve(
1449  data.currency(), engineFactory->configuration(MarketContext::pricing)))
1450  .withInflationNotional(addInflationNotional);
1451 
1452  if (couponCap)
1453  yoyLeg.withCaps(buildScheduledVector(yoyLegData->caps(), yoyLegData->capDates(), schedule));
1454 
1455  if (couponFloor)
1456  yoyLeg.withFloors(buildScheduledVector(yoyLegData->floors(), yoyLegData->floorDates(), schedule));
1457 
1458  leg = yoyLeg.operator Leg();
1459 
1460  if (couponCapFloor) {
1461  // get a coupon pricer for the leg
1462  boost::shared_ptr<EngineBuilder> builder = engineFactory->builder("CapFlooredNonStdYYLeg");
1463  QL_REQUIRE(builder, "No builder found for CapFlooredNonStdYYLeg");
1464  boost::shared_ptr<CapFlooredNonStandardYoYLegEngineBuilder> cappedFlooredYoYBuilder =
1465  boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CapFlooredNonStandardYoYLegEngineBuilder>(builder);
1466  string indexname = zcIndex->name();
1467  boost::shared_ptr<InflationCouponPricer> couponPricer =
1468  cappedFlooredYoYBuilder->engine(indexname.replace(indexname.find(" ", 0), 1, ""));
1469 
1470  // set coupon pricer for the leg
1471 
1472  for (Size i = 0; i < leg.size(); i++) {
1473  boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantExt::NonStandardCappedFlooredYoYInflationCoupon>(leg[i])->setPricer(
1474  boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantExt::NonStandardYoYInflationCouponPricer>(couponPricer));
1475  }
1476 
1477  // build naked option leg if required
1478  if (yoyLegData->nakedOption()) {
1479  leg = StrippedCappedFlooredYoYInflationCouponLeg(leg);
1480  for (auto const& t : leg) {
1481  auto s = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<StrippedCappedFlooredYoYInflationCoupon>(t);
1482  }
1483  }
1484  }
1485  }
1486  return leg;
1487 }

1493  QL_REQUIRE(cmsData, "Wrong LegType, expected CMS, got " << data.legType());
1494 
1495  Schedule schedule = makeSchedule(data.schedule(), openEndDateReplacement);
1496  DayCounter dc = parseDayCounter(data.dayCounter());
1497  BusinessDayConvention bdc = parseBusinessDayConvention(data.paymentConvention());
1498  bool couponCapFloor = cmsData->caps().size() > 0 || cmsData->floors().size() > 0;
1499  bool nakedCapFloor = caps.size() > 0 || floors.size() > 0;
1500

1502  ore::data::buildScheduledVectorNormalised(cmsData->spreads(), cmsData->spreadDates(), schedule, 0.0);
1503  vector<double> gearings =
1504  ore::data::buildScheduledVectorNormalised(cmsData->gearings(), cmsData->gearingDates(), schedule, 1.0);
1505  vector<double> notionals = buildScheduledVector(data.notionals(), data.notionalDates(), schedule);
1506  Size fixingDays = cmsData->fixingDays() == Null<Size>() ? swapIndex->fixingDays() : cmsData->fixingDays();
1507

1511  .withNotionals(notionals)
1512  .withSpreads(spreads)
1513  .withGearings(gearings)
1514  .withPaymentDayCounter(dc)
1515  .withPaymentAdjustment(bdc)
1516  .withFixingDays(fixingDays)
1517  .inArrears(cmsData->isInArrears());
1518

1520  vector<string> capFloorDates;
1521 
1522  if (caps.size() > 0)
1523  cmsLeg.withCaps(buildScheduledVector(caps, capFloorDates, schedule));
1524 
1525  if (floors.size() > 0)
1526  cmsLeg.withFloors(buildScheduledVector(floors, capFloorDates, schedule));
1527  } else if (couponCapFloor) {
1528  if (cmsData->caps().size() > 0)
1529  cmsLeg.withCaps(buildScheduledVector(cmsData->caps(), cmsData->capDates(), schedule));
1530 
1531  if (cmsData->floors().size() > 0)
1532  cmsLeg.withFloors(buildScheduledVector(cmsData->floors(), cmsData->floorDates(), schedule));
1533  }
1534 
1535  if (!attachPricer)
1536  return cmsLeg;
1537 
1538  // Get a coupon pricer for the leg
1539  boost::shared_ptr<EngineBuilder> builder = engineFactory->builder("CMS");
1540  QL_REQUIRE(builder, "No builder found for CmsLeg");
1541  boost::shared_ptr<CmsCouponPricerBuilder> cmsSwapBuilder =
1542  boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CmsCouponPricerBuilder>(builder);
1543  boost::shared_ptr<FloatingRateCouponPricer> couponPricer = cmsSwapBuilder->engine(swapIndex->currency());
1544 
1545  // Loop over the coupons in the leg and set pricer
1546  Leg tmpLeg = cmsLeg;
1547  QuantLib::setCouponPricer(tmpLeg, couponPricer);
1548 
1549  // build naked option leg if required
1550  if (cmsData->nakedOption()) {
1551  tmpLeg = StrippedCappedFlooredCouponLeg(tmpLeg);
1552  // fix for missing registration in ql 1.13
1553  for (auto const& t : tmpLeg) {
1554  auto s = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<StrippedCappedFlooredCoupon>(t);
1555  if (s != nullptr)
1556  s->registerWith(s->underlying());
1557  }
1558  }
1559  return tmpLeg;
1560 }

1622  QL_FAIL("caps/floors not supported in DigitalCMSOptions");
1623

1625  return digitalCmsLeg;

1801  {
1802  boost::shared_ptr<EquityLegData> eqLegData = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<EquityLegData>(data.concreteLegData());
1803  QL_REQUIRE(eqLegData, "Wrong LegType, expected Equity, got " << data.legType());
1804 
1805  Schedule schedule = makeSchedule(data.schedule(), openEndDateReplacement);
1806  DayCounter dc = parseDayCounter(data.dayCounter());
1807  BusinessDayConvention bdc = parseBusinessDayConvention(data.paymentConvention());
1808  bool isTotalReturn = eqLegData->returnType() == "Total";
1809  bool isAbsoluteReturn = eqLegData->returnType() == "Absolute";
1810  Real dividendFactor = eqLegData->dividendFactor();
1811  Real initialPrice = eqLegData->initialPrice();
1812  bool initialPriceIsInTargetCcy = false;
1813 
1814  if (!eqLegData->initialPriceCurrency().empty()) {
1815  // parse currencies to handle minor currencies
1816  Currency initialPriceCurrency = parseCurrencyWithMinors(eqLegData->initialPriceCurrency());
1817  Currency dataCurrency = parseCurrencyWithMinors(data.currency());
1818  Currency eqCurrency;
1819  // set equity currency
1820  if (!eqLegData->eqCurrency().empty())
1821  eqCurrency = parseCurrencyWithMinors(eqLegData->eqCurrency());
1822  else if (!equityCurve->currency().empty())
1823  eqCurrency = equityCurve->currency();
1824  else
1825  TLOG("Cannot find currency for equity " << equityCurve->name());
1826 
1827  // initial price currency must match leg or equity currency
1828  QL_REQUIRE(initialPriceCurrency == dataCurrency || initialPriceCurrency == eqCurrency || eqCurrency.empty(),
1829  "initial price ccy (" << initialPriceCurrency << ") must match either leg ccy (" << dataCurrency
1830  << ") or equity ccy (if given, got '" << eqCurrency << "')");
1831  initialPriceIsInTargetCcy = initialPriceCurrency == dataCurrency;
1832  // adjust for minor currency
1833  initialPrice = convertMinorToMajorCurrency(eqLegData->initialPriceCurrency(), initialPrice);
1834  }
1835  bool notionalReset = eqLegData->notionalReset();
1836  Natural fixingDays = eqLegData->fixingDays();
1837  Natural paymentLag = data.paymentLag();
1838  ScheduleData valuationData = eqLegData->valuationSchedule();
1839  Schedule valuationSchedule;
1840  if (valuationData.hasData())
1841  valuationSchedule = makeSchedule(valuationData, openEndDateReplacement);
1842  vector<double> notionals = buildScheduledVector(data.notionals(), data.notionalDates(), schedule);
1843 
1844  applyAmortization(notionals, data, schedule, false);
1845  Leg leg = EquityLeg(schedule, equityCurve, fxIndex)
1846  .withNotionals(notionals)
1847  .withQuantity(eqLegData->quantity())
1848  .withPaymentDayCounter(dc)
1849  .withPaymentAdjustment(bdc)
1850  .withPaymentLag(paymentLag)
1851  .withTotalReturn(isTotalReturn)
1852  .withAbsoluteReturn(isAbsoluteReturn)
1853  .withDividendFactor(dividendFactor)
1854  .withInitialPrice(initialPrice)
1855  .withInitialPriceIsInTargetCcy(initialPriceIsInTargetCcy)
1856  .withNotionalReset(notionalReset)
1857  .withFixingDays(fixingDays)
1858  .withValuationSchedule(valuationSchedule);
1859 
1860  QL_REQUIRE(leg.size() > 0, "Empty Equity Leg");
1861 
1862  return leg;
1863 }

◆ currentNotional()

Definition at line 1865 of file legdata.cpp.

1865  {
1866  Date today = Settings::instance().evaluationDate();
1867  // assume the leg is sorted
1868  // We just take the first coupon::nominal we find, otherwise return 0
1869  for (auto cf : leg) {
1870  if (cf->date() > today) {
1871  boost::shared_ptr<Coupon> coupon = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantLib::Coupon>(cf);
1872  if (coupon)
1873  return coupon->nominal();
1874  }
1875  }
1876  return 0;
1877 }

◆ buildAmortizationScheduleFixedAmount()

vector< double > buildAmortizationScheduleFixedAmount ( const vector< double > &  notionals,
const Schedule &  schedule,
const AmortizationData &  data 
)

Definition at line 1890 of file legdata.cpp.

1891  {
1892  LOG("Build fixed amortization notional schedule");
1893  vector<double> nominals = normaliseToSchedule(notionals, schedule, (Real)Null<Real>());
1894  Date startDate = parseDate(data.startDate());
1895  Date endDate = data.endDate() == "" ? Date::maxDate() : parseDate(data.endDate());
1896  bool underflow = data.underflow();
1897  Period amortPeriod = parsePeriod(data.frequency());
1898  double amort = data.value();
1899  Date lastAmortDate = Date::minDate();
1900  for (Size i = 0; i < schedule.size() - 1; i++) {
1901  if (i > 0 && schedule[i] > lastAmortDate + amortPeriod - 4 * Days && schedule[i] >= startDate &&
1902  schedule[i] < endDate) { // FIXME: tolerance
1903  nominals[i] = nominals[i - 1] - amort;
1904  lastAmortDate = schedule[i];
1905  } else if (i > 0 && lastAmortDate > Date::minDate()) {
1906  nominals[i] = nominals[i - 1];
1907  }
1908  if (amort > nominals[i] && underflow == false)
1909  amort = std::max(nominals[i], 0.0);
1910  }
1911  LOG("Fixed amortization notional schedule done");
1912  return nominals;
1913 }

◆ buildAmortizationScheduleRelativeToInitialNotional()

)

Definition at line 1915 of file legdata.cpp.

1917  {
1918  LOG("Build notional schedule with amortizations expressed as percentages of initial notional");
1919  vector<double> nominals = normaliseToSchedule(notionals, schedule, (Real)Null<Real>());
1920  Date startDate = parseDate(data.startDate());
1921  Date endDate = data.endDate() == "" ? Date::maxDate() : parseDate(data.endDate());
1922  bool underflow = data.underflow();
1923  Period amortPeriod = parsePeriod(data.frequency());
1924  double fraction = data.value(); // first difference to "FixedAmount"
1925  QL_REQUIRE(fraction >= 0.0 && fraction <= 1.0,
1926  "amortization fraction " << fraction << " out of range"); // second difference to "FixedAmount"
1927  double amort = fraction * nominals.front(); // third difference to "FixedAmount"
1928  Date lastAmortDate = Date::minDate();
1929  for (Size i = 0; i < schedule.size() - 1; i++) {
1930  if (i > 0 && schedule[i] > lastAmortDate + amortPeriod - 4 * Days && schedule[i] >= startDate &&
1931  schedule[i] < endDate) { // FIXME: tolerance
1932  nominals[i] = nominals[i - 1] - amort;
1933  lastAmortDate = schedule[i];
1934  } else if (i > 0 && lastAmortDate > Date::minDate())
1935  nominals[i] = nominals[i - 1];
1936  if (amort > nominals[i] && underflow == false) {
1937  amort = std::max(nominals[i], 0.0);
1938  }
1939  }
1940  LOG("Fixed amortization notional schedule done");
1941  return nominals;
1942 }

◆ buildAmortizationScheduleRelativeToPreviousNotional()

vector< double > buildAmortizationScheduleRelativeToPreviousNotional ( const vector< double > &  notionals,
const Schedule &  schedule,
const AmortizationData &  data 
)

Definition at line 1944 of file legdata.cpp.

1946  {
1947  LOG("Build notional schedule with amortizations expressed as percentages of previous notionals");
1948  vector<double> nominals = normaliseToSchedule(notionals, schedule, (Real)Null<Real>());
1949  Date startDate = parseDate(data.startDate());
1950  Date endDate = data.endDate() == "" ? Date::maxDate() : parseDate(data.endDate());
1951  Period amortPeriod = parsePeriod(data.frequency());
1952  double fraction = data.value();
1953  QL_REQUIRE(fraction >= 0.0 && fraction <= 1.0, "amortization fraction " << fraction << " out of range");
1954  Date lastAmortDate = Date::minDate();
1955  for (Size i = 0; i < schedule.size() - 1; i++) {
1956  if (i > 0 && schedule[i] > lastAmortDate + amortPeriod - 4 * Days && schedule[i] >= startDate &&
1957  schedule[i] < endDate) { // FIXME: tolerance
1958  nominals[i] = nominals[i - 1] * (1.0 - fraction);
1959  lastAmortDate = schedule[i];
1960  } else if (i > 0 && lastAmortDate > Date::minDate())
1961  nominals[i] = nominals[i - 1];
1962  }
1963  LOG("Fixed amortization notional schedule done");
1964  return nominals;
1965 }

◆ buildAmortizationScheduleFixedAnnuity()

vector< double > buildAmortizationScheduleFixedAnnuity ( const vector< double > &  notionals,
const vector< double > &  rates,
const Schedule &  schedule,
const AmortizationData &  data,
const DayCounter &  dc 
)

Definition at line 1967 of file legdata.cpp.

1969  {
1970  LOG("Build fixed annuity notional schedule");
1971  vector<double> nominals = normaliseToSchedule(notionals, schedule, (Real)Null<Real>());
1972  Date startDate = parseDate(data.startDate());
1973  Date endDate = data.endDate() == "" ? Date::maxDate() : parseDate(data.endDate());
1974  bool underflow = data.underflow();
1975  double annuity = data.value();
1976  Real amort = 0.0;
1977  Date lastAmortDate = Date::minDate();
1978  for (Size i = 0; i < schedule.size() - 1; i++) {
1979  if (i > 0 && schedule[i] >= startDate && schedule[i] < endDate) {
1980  nominals[i] = nominals[i - 1] - amort;
1981  lastAmortDate = schedule[i];
1982  } else if (i > 0 && lastAmortDate > Date::minDate())
1983  nominals[i] = nominals[i - 1];
1984  Real dcf = dc.yearFraction(schedule[i], schedule[i + 1]);
1985  Real rate = i < rates.size() ? rates[i] : rates.back();
1986  amort = annuity - rate * nominals[i] * dcf;
1987  if (amort > nominals[i] && underflow == false) {
1988  amort = std::max(nominals[i], 0.0);
1989  }
1990  }
1991  LOG("Fixed Annuity notional schedule done");
1992  return nominals;
1993 }

◆ applyAmortization()

1996  {
1997  Date lastEndDate = Date::minDate();

1999  if (!amort.initialized())
2000  continue;
2001  Date startDate = parseDate(amort.startDate());
2002  QL_REQUIRE(startDate >= lastEndDate, "Amortization start date ("
2003  << startDate << ") is earlier than last end date (" << lastEndDate
2004  << ")");

2006  AmortizationType amortizationType = parseAmortizationType(amort.type());
2007  if (amortizationType == AmortizationType::FixedAmount)
2008  notionals = buildAmortizationScheduleFixedAmount(notionals, schedule, amort);
2009  else if (amortizationType == AmortizationType::RelativeToInitialNotional)
2010  notionals = buildAmortizationScheduleRelativeToInitialNotional(notionals, schedule, amort);
2011  else if (amortizationType == AmortizationType::RelativeToPreviousNotional)
2012  notionals = buildAmortizationScheduleRelativeToPreviousNotional(notionals, schedule, amort);
2013  else if (amortizationType == AmortizationType::Annuity) {
2014  QL_REQUIRE(annuityAllowed, "Amortization type Annuity not allowed for leg type " << data.legType());
2015  if (!rates.empty())
2016  notionals = buildAmortizationScheduleFixedAnnuity(notionals, rates, schedule, amort,
2017  parseDayCounter(data.dayCounter()));
2018  } else
2019  QL_FAIL("AmortizationType " << amort.type() << " not supported");
2020  // check that for a floating leg we only have one amortization block, if the type is annuity
2021  // we recognise a floating leg by an empty (fixed) rates vector
2022  if (rates.empty() && amortizationType == AmortizationType::Annuity) {
2023  QL_REQUIRE(data.amortizationData().size() == 1,
2024  "Floating Leg supports only one amortisation block of type Annuity");
2025  }
2026  }
2027 }

◆ applyIndexing()

Definition at line 2029 of file legdata.cpp.

2031  {
2032  for (auto const& indexing : data.indexing()) {
2033  if (indexing.hasData()) {
2034  DLOG("apply indexing (index='" << indexing.index() << "') to leg of type " << data.legType());
2035  QL_REQUIRE(engineFactory, "applyIndexing: engineFactory required");
2036 
2037  // we allow indexing by equity, commodity and FX indices (technically any QuantLib::Index
2038  // will work, so the list of index types can be extended here if required)
2039  boost::shared_ptr<Index> index;
2040  string config = engineFactory->configuration(MarketContext::pricing);
2041  if (boost::starts_with(indexing.index(), "EQ-")) {
2042  string eqName = indexing.index().substr(3);
2043  index = *engineFactory->market()->equityCurve(eqName, config);
2044  } else if (boost::starts_with(indexing.index(), "FX-")) {
2045  auto tmp = parseFxIndex(indexing.index());
2046  Currency ccy1 = tmp->targetCurrency();
2047  Currency ccy2 = tmp->sourceCurrency();
2048  QL_REQUIRE(ccy1.code() == data.currency() || ccy2.code() == data.currency(),
2049  "applyIndexing: fx index '" << indexing.index() << "' ccys do not match leg ccy ("
2050  << data.currency() << ")");
2051  std::string domestic = data.currency();
2052  std::string foreign = ccy1.code() == domestic ? ccy2.code() : ccy1.code();
2053  index = buildFxIndex(indexing.index(), domestic, foreign, engineFactory->market(),
2054  engineFactory->configuration(MarketContext::pricing),
2055  indexing.indexFixingCalendar(), indexing.indexFixingDays());
2056  } else if (boost::starts_with(indexing.index(), "COMM-")) {
2057  auto tmp = parseCommodityIndex(indexing.index());
2058  index =
2059  parseCommodityIndex(indexing.index(), true, tmp->fixingCalendar(),
2060  engineFactory->market()->commodityPriceCurve(tmp->underlyingName(), config));
2061  } else if (boost::starts_with(indexing.index(), "BOND-")) {
2062  // if we build a bond index, we add the required fixings for the bond underlying
2063  boost::shared_ptr<BondIndex> bi = parseBondIndex(indexing.index());
2064  QL_REQUIRE(!(boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<BondFuturesIndex>(bi)),
2065  "BondFuture Legs are not yet supported");
2066  BondData bondData(bi->securityName(), 1.0);
2067  index = buildBondIndex(bondData, indexing.indexIsDirty(), indexing.indexIsRelative(),
2068  parseCalendar(indexing.indexFixingCalendar()),
2069  indexing.indexIsConditionalOnSurvival(), engineFactory, requiredFixings);
2070  } else {
2071  QL_FAIL("invalid index '" << indexing.index()
2072  << "' in indexing data, expected EQ-, FX-, COMM-, BOND- index");
2073  }
2074 
2075  QL_REQUIRE(index, "applyIndexing(): index is null, this is unexpected");
2076 
2077  // apply the indexing
2078  IndexedCouponLeg indLeg(leg, indexing.quantity(), index);
2079  indLeg.withInitialFixing(indexing.initialFixing());
2080  indLeg.withFixingDays(indexing.fixingDays());
2081  indLeg.inArrearsFixing(indexing.inArrearsFixing());
2082  if (indexing.valuationSchedule().hasData())
2083  indLeg.withValuationSchedule(makeSchedule(indexing.valuationSchedule(), openEndDateReplacement));
2084  if (!indexing.fixingCalendar().empty())
2085  indLeg.withFixingCalendar(parseCalendar(indexing.fixingCalendar()));
2086  if (!indexing.fixingConvention().empty())
2087  indLeg.withFixingConvention(parseBusinessDayConvention(indexing.fixingConvention()));
2088  leg = indLeg;
2089 
2090  // add to the qlToOREIndexNames map
2091  qlToOREIndexNames[index->name()] = indexing.index();
2092  }
2093  }
2094 }

boost::shared_ptr< QuantExt::FxIndex > buildFxIndex ( const string &  fxIndex,

const string &  calendar,
Size  fixingDays,

)

Definition at line 2096 of file legdata.cpp.

2098  {
2099  // 1. Parse the index we have with no term structures
2100  boost::shared_ptr<QuantExt::FxIndex> fxIndexBase = parseFxIndex(fxIndex);
2101 
2102  // get market data objects - we set up the index using source/target, fixing days
2103  // and calendar from legData_[i].fxIndex()
2104  string source = fxIndexBase->sourceCurrency().code();
2105  string target = fxIndexBase->targetCurrency().code();
2106 
2107  // If useXbsCurves is true, try to link the FX index to xccy based curves. There will be none if source or target
2108  // is equal to the base currency of the run so we must use the try/catch.
2109  Handle<YieldTermStructure> sorTS;
2110  Handle<YieldTermStructure> tarTS;
2111  if (useXbsCurves) {
2112  sorTS = xccyYieldCurve(market, source, configuration);
2113  tarTS = xccyYieldCurve(market, target, configuration);
2114  } else {
2115  sorTS = market->discountCurve(source, configuration);
2116  tarTS = market->discountCurve(target, configuration);
2117  }
2118 
2119  Handle<Quote> spot = market->fxSpot(source + target);
2120  Calendar cal = parseCalendar(calendar);
2121 
2122  // Now check the ccy and foreignCcy from the legdata, work out if we need to invert or not
2123  bool invertFxIndex = false;
2124  if (domestic == target && foreign == source) {
2125  invertFxIndex = false;
2126  } else if (domestic == source && foreign == target) {
2127  invertFxIndex = true;
2128  } else {
2129  QL_FAIL("Cannot combine FX Index " << fxIndex << " with reset ccy " << domestic << " and reset foreignCurrency "
2130  << foreign);
2131  }
2132 
2133  auto fxi = boost::make_shared<FxIndex>(fxIndexBase->familyName(), fixingDays, fxIndexBase->sourceCurrency(),
2134  fxIndexBase->targetCurrency(), cal, spot, sorTS, tarTS, invertFxIndex);
2135 
2136  QL_REQUIRE(fxi, "Failed to build FXIndex " << fxIndex);
2137 
2138  return fxi;
2139 }

2196  engineFactory->market()->securitySpread(securityId, engineFactory->configuration(MarketContext::pricing));
2197  } catch (...) {
2198  }

2201

2203  defaultCurve, recovery, spread, incomeCurve, conditionalOnSurvival);
2204 }

◆ joinLegs()

Leg joinLegs ( const std::vector< Leg > &  legs)

Definition at line 2206 of file legdata.cpp.

2206  {
2207  Leg masterLeg;
2208  Size lastLeg = Null<Size>();
2209  for (Size i = 0; i < legs.size(); ++i) {
2210  // skip empty legs
2211  if (legs[i].empty())
2212  continue;
2213  // check if the periods of adjacent legs are consistent
2214  if (lastLeg != Null<Size>()) {
2215  auto lcpn = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<Coupon>(legs[lastLeg].back());
2216  auto fcpn = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<Coupon>(legs[i].front());
2217  QL_REQUIRE(lcpn, "joinLegs: expected coupon as last cashflow in leg #" << lastLeg);
2218  QL_REQUIRE(fcpn, "joinLegs: expected coupon as first cashflow in leg #" << i);
2219  QL_REQUIRE(lcpn->accrualEndDate() == fcpn->accrualStartDate(),
2220  "joinLegs: accrual end date of last coupon in leg #"
2221  << lastLeg << " (" << lcpn->accrualEndDate()
2222  << ") is not equal to accrual start date of first coupon in leg #" << i << " ("
2223  << fcpn->accrualStartDate() << ")");
2224  lastLeg = i;
2225  }
2226  // copy legs together
2227  masterLeg.insert(masterLeg.end(), legs[i].begin(), legs[i].end());
2228  }
2229  return masterLeg;
2230 }

2246 
2247  boost::shared_ptr<Coupon> c = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<Coupon>(leg[j]);
2248  QL_REQUIRE(c, "Expected each cashflow in FX resetting leg to be of type Coupon");
2249 
2250  // Build a pair of notional flows, one at the start and one at the end of the accrual period.
2251  // They both have the same FX fixing date => same amount in this leg's currency.
2252  boost::shared_ptr<CashFlow> outCf;
2253  boost::shared_ptr<CashFlow> inCf;
2254  Date fixingDate;
2255  if (j == 0) {
2256  // Two possibilities for first coupon:
2257  // 1. we have not been given a domestic notional so it is an FX linked coupon
2258  // 2. we have been given an explicit domestic notional so it is a simple cashflow
2259  if (data.notionals().size() == 0) {
2260  fixingDate = fxIndex->fixingDate(c->accrualStartDate());
2261  if (data.notionalInitialExchange()) {
2262  outCf = boost::make_shared<FXLinkedCashFlow>(c->accrualStartDate(), fixingDate,
2263  -foreignNotional, fxIndex);
2264  }
2265  // if there is only one period we generate the cash flow at the period end
2266  // only if there is a final notional exchange
2267  if (leg.size() > 1 || data.notionalFinalExchange()) {
2268  inCf = boost::make_shared<FXLinkedCashFlow>(c->accrualEndDate(), fixingDate, foreignNotional,
2269  fxIndex);
2270  }
2271  } else {
2272  if (data.notionalInitialExchange()) {
2273  outCf = boost::make_shared<SimpleCashFlow>(-c->nominal(), c->accrualStartDate());
2274  }
2275  if (leg.size() > 1 || data.notionalFinalExchange()) {
2276  inCf = boost::make_shared<SimpleCashFlow>(c->nominal(), c->accrualEndDate());
2277  }
2278  }
2279  } else {
2280  fixingDate = fxIndex->fixingDate(c->accrualStartDate());
2281  outCf =
2282  boost::make_shared<FXLinkedCashFlow>(c->accrualStartDate(), fixingDate, -foreignNotional, fxIndex);
2283  // we don't want a final one, unless there is notional exchange
2284  if (j < leg.size() - 1 || data.notionalFinalExchange()) {
2285  inCf =
2286  boost::make_shared<FXLinkedCashFlow>(c->accrualEndDate(), fixingDate, foreignNotional, fxIndex);
2287  }
2288  }
2289 
2290  // Add the cashflows to the notional leg if they have been populated
2291  if (outCf) {
2292  resettingLeg.push_back(outCf);
2293  if (fixingDate != Date())
2294  requiredFixings.addFixingDate(fixingDate, data.fxIndex(), outCf->date());
2295  }
2296  if (inCf) {
2297  resettingLeg.push_back(inCf);
2298  if (fixingDate != Date())
2299  requiredFixings.addFixingDate(fixingDate, data.fxIndex(), inCf->date());
2300  }
2301  }
2302 
2303  if (data.notionalAmortizingExchange()) {
2304  QL_FAIL("Cannot have an amoritizing notional with FX reset");
2305  }
2306 
2307  return resettingLeg;
2308 
2309  } else if ((data.notionalInitialExchange() || data.notionalFinalExchange() || data.notionalAmortizingExchange()) &&
2310  (data.legType() != "CPI")) {
2311 
2312  // check for notional exchanges on non FX reseting trades
2313 
2314  return makeNotionalLeg(leg, data.notionalInitialExchange(), data.notionalFinalExchange(),
2315  data.notionalAmortizingExchange(), parseBusinessDayConvention(data.paymentConvention()),
2316  parseCalendar(data.paymentCalendar()));
2317  } else {
2318  return Leg();
2319  }
2320 }

◆ buildScheduledVector()

vector< T > buildScheduledVector ( const vector< T > &  values,
const vector< string > &  dates,
const Schedule &  schedule,
const bool  checkAllValuesAppearInResult = false 
)

Build a full vector of values from the given node.

Definition at line 973 of file legdata.hpp.

974  {
975  if (values.size() < 2 || dates.size() == 0)
976  return values;
977 
978  QL_REQUIRE(values.size() == dates.size(), "Value / Date size mismatch in buildScheduledVector."
979  << "Value:" << values.size() << ", Dates:" << dates.size());
980 
981  // Need to use schedule logic
982  // Length of data will be 1 less than schedule
983  //
984  // Notional 100
985  // Notional {startDate 2015-01-01} 200
986  // Notional {startDate 2016-01-01} 300
987  //
988  // Given schedule June, Dec from 2014 to 2016 (6 dates, 5 coupons)
989  // we return 100, 100, 200, 200, 300
990 
991  // The first node must not have a date.
992  // If the second one has a date, all the rest must have, and we process
993  // If the second one does not have a date, none of them must have one
994  // and we return the vector uneffected.
995  QL_REQUIRE(dates[0] == "", "Invalid date " << dates[0] << " for first node");
996  if (dates[1] == "") {
997  // They must all be empty and then we return values
998  for (Size i = 2; i < dates.size(); i++) {
999  QL_REQUIRE(dates[i] == "", "Invalid date " << dates[i] << " for node " << i
1000  << ". Cannot mix dates and non-dates attributes");
1001  }
1002  return values;
1003  }
1004 
1005  // We have nodes with date attributes now
1006  Size len = schedule.size() - 1;
1007  vector<T> data(len);
1008  Size j = 0, max_j = dates.size() - 1; // j is the index of date/value vector. 0 to max_j
1009  Date d = parseDate(dates[j + 1]); // The first start date
1010  for (Size i = 0; i < len; i++) { // loop over data vector and populate it.
1011  // If j == max_j we just fall through and take the final value
1012  while (schedule[i] >= d && j < max_j) {
1013  j++;
1014  if (j < max_j) {
1015  QL_REQUIRE(dates[j + 1] != "", "Cannot have empty date attribute for node " << j + 1);
1016  d = parseDate(dates[j + 1]);
1017  }
1018  }
1019  data[i] = values[j];
1020  }
1021 
1022  if (checkAllValuesAppearInResult) {
1023  auto it = checkAllValuesAppearInScheduledVector<T>(data, values);
1024  QL_REQUIRE(it == values.end(),
1025  "buildScheduledVector: input value '" << *it << " does not appear in the result vector");
1026  }
1027 
1028  return data;
1029 }

QuantLib::Schedule makeSchedule ( const ScheduleDates &  data)

101  {
102  QL_REQUIRE(data.dates().size() > 0, "Must provide at least 1 date for Schedule");
103  Calendar calendar = parseCalendar(data.calendar());
104  BusinessDayConvention convention = Unadjusted;
105  if (data.convention() != "")
106  convention = parseBusinessDayConvention(data.convention());
107  // Avoid compiler warning on gcc
108  // https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_74_0/libs/optional/doc/html/boost_optional/tutorial/
109  // gotchas/false_positive_with__wmaybe_uninitialized.html
110  auto tenor = boost::make_optional(false, Period());

112  tenor = parsePeriod(data.tenor());
113  bool endOfMonth = false;

118  std::set<Date> uniqueDates;
119  for (const string& d : data.dates())
120  uniqueDates.insert(calendar.adjust(parseDate(d), convention));
121 
122  return Schedule(vector<Date>(uniqueDates.begin(), uniqueDates.end()), calendar, convention, boost::none, tenor,
123  boost::none, endOfMonth);
124 }

◆ makeSchedule() [2/5]

Schedule ore::data::makeSchedule ( const ScheduleRules &  data,
const Date &  openEndDateReplacement 
)

Definition at line 126 of file schedule.cpp.

126  {
127  QL_REQUIRE(!data.endDate().empty() || openEndDateReplacement != Null<Date>(),
128  "makeSchedule(): Schedule does not have an end date, this is not supported in this context / for this "
129  "trade type. Please provide an end date.");
130  QL_REQUIRE(!data.endDate().empty() || data.lastDate().empty(),
131  "makeSchedule(): If no end date is given, a last date is not allowed either. Please remove the last "
132  "date from the schedule.");
133  Calendar calendar = parseCalendar(data.calendar());
134  Date startDate = parseDate(data.startDate());
135  Date endDate = data.endDate().empty() ? openEndDateReplacement : parseDate(data.endDate());
136  // Handle trivial case here
137  if (startDate == endDate)
138  return Schedule(vector<Date>(1, startDate), calendar);
139 
140  QL_REQUIRE(startDate < endDate, "StartDate " << startDate << " is ahead of EndDate " << endDate);
141 
142  Date firstDate = parseDate(data.firstDate());
143  Date lastDate = parseDate(data.lastDate());
144  Period tenor = parsePeriod(data.tenor());
145 
146  // defaults
147  BusinessDayConvention bdc = ModifiedFollowing;
148  BusinessDayConvention bdcEnd = ModifiedFollowing;
149  DateGeneration::Rule rule = DateGeneration::Forward;
150  bool endOfMonth = false;
151 
152  // now check the strings, if they are empty we take defaults
153  if (!data.convention().empty())
154  bdc = parseBusinessDayConvention(data.convention());
155  if (!data.termConvention().empty())
156  bdcEnd = parseBusinessDayConvention(data.termConvention());
157  else
158  bdcEnd = bdc; // except here
159  if (!data.rule().empty())
160  rule = parseDateGenerationRule(data.rule());
161  if (!data.endOfMonth().empty())
162  endOfMonth = parseBool(data.endOfMonth());
163 
164  if ((rule == DateGeneration::CDS || rule == DateGeneration::CDS2015) &&
165  (firstDate != Null<Date>() || lastDate != Null<Date>())) {
166  // Special handling of first date and last date in combination with CDS and CDS2015 rules:
167  // To be able to construct CDS schedules with front or back stub periods, we overwrite the
168  // first (last) date of the schedule built in QL with a given first (last) date
169  // The schedule builder in QL itself is not capable of doing this, it just throws an exception
170  // if a first (last) date is given in combination with a CDS / CDS2015 date generation rule.
171  std::vector<Date> dates = Schedule(startDate, endDate, tenor, calendar, bdc, bdcEnd, rule, endOfMonth).dates();
172  QL_REQUIRE(!dates.empty(),
173  "got empty CDS or CDS2015 schedule, startDate = " << startDate << ", endDate = " << endDate);
174  if (firstDate != Date())
175  dates.front() = firstDate;
176  if (lastDate != Date())
177  dates.back() = lastDate;
178  return Schedule(dates, calendar, bdc, bdcEnd, tenor, rule, endOfMonth);
179  } else {
180  return Schedule(startDate, endDate, tenor, calendar, bdc, bdcEnd, rule, endOfMonth, firstDate, lastDate);
181  }
182 }
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ makeSchedule() [3/5]

Schedule ore::data::makeSchedule ( const ScheduleData &  data,
const Date &  openEndDateReplacement 
)

Definition at line 202 of file schedule.cpp.

202  {
203  // only the last rule-based schedule is allowed to have an open end date, check this
204  for (Size i = 1; i < data.rules().size(); ++i) {
205  QL_REQUIRE(!data.rules()[i - 1].endDate().empty(),
206  "makeSchedule: only last schedule is allowed to have an open end date");
207  }
208  // build all the date and rule based sub-schedules we have
209  vector<Schedule> schedules;
210  for (auto& d : data.dates())
211  schedules.push_back(makeSchedule(d));
212  for (auto& r : data.rules())
213  schedules.push_back(makeSchedule(r, openEndDateReplacement));
214  QL_REQUIRE(!schedules.empty(), "No dates or rules to build Schedule from");
215  if (schedules.size() == 1)
216  // if we have just one, use that (most common case)
217  return schedules.front();
218  else {
219  // if we have multiple, combine them
220 
221  // 1) sort by start date
222  std::sort(schedules.begin(), schedules.end(),
223  [](const Schedule& lhs, const Schedule& rhs) -> bool { return lhs.startDate() < rhs.startDate(); });
224 
225  // 2) check if meta data is present, and if yes if it is consistent across schedules;
226  // the only exception is the term date convention, this is taken from the last schedule always
227  BusinessDayConvention convention = Null<BusinessDayConvention>(),
228  termConvention = Unadjusted; // initialization prevents gcc warning
229  Calendar calendar;
230  Period tenor;
231  DateGeneration::Rule rule = DateGeneration::Zero; // initialization prevents gcc warning
232  bool endOfMonth = false; // initialization prevents gcc warning
233  bool hasCalendar = false, hasConvention = false, hasTermConvention = false, hasTenor = false, hasRule = false,
234  hasEndOfMonth = false, hasConsistentCalendar = true, hasConsistentConvention = true,
235  hasConsistentTenor = true, hasConsistentRule = true, hasConsistentEndOfMonth = true;
236  for (auto& d : data.dates()) {
237  updateData<Calendar>(d.calendar(), calendar, hasCalendar, hasConsistentCalendar, parseCalendarTemp);
238  updateData<BusinessDayConvention>(d.convention(), convention, hasConvention, hasConsistentConvention,
239  parseBusinessDayConvention);
240  updateData<Period>(d.tenor(), tenor, hasTenor, hasConsistentTenor, parsePeriod);
241  }
242  for (auto& d : data.rules()) {
243  updateData<Calendar>(d.calendar(), calendar, hasCalendar, hasConsistentCalendar, parseCalendarTemp);
244  updateData<BusinessDayConvention>(d.convention(), convention, hasConvention, hasConsistentConvention,
245  parseBusinessDayConvention);
246  updateData<Period>(d.tenor(), tenor, hasTenor, hasConsistentTenor, parsePeriod);
247  updateData<bool>(d.endOfMonth(), endOfMonth, hasEndOfMonth, hasConsistentEndOfMonth, parseBool);
248  updateData<DateGeneration::Rule>(d.rule(), rule, hasRule, hasConsistentRule, parseDateGenerationRule);
249  if (d.termConvention() != "") {
250  hasTermConvention = true;
251  termConvention = parseBusinessDayConvention(d.termConvention());
252  }
253  }
254 
255  // 3) combine dates and fill isRegular flag
256  const Schedule& s0 = schedules.front();
257  vector<Date> dates = s0.dates();
258  std::vector<bool> isRegular(s0.dates().size() - 1, false);
259  if (s0.hasIsRegular())
260  isRegular = s0.isRegular();
261  // will be removed, if next schedule's front date is matching the last date of current schedule
262  isRegular.push_back(false);
263  for (Size i = 1; i < schedules.size(); ++i) {
264  const Schedule& s = schedules[i];
265  QL_REQUIRE(dates.back() <= s.dates().front(), "Dates mismatch");
266  // if the end points match up, skip one to avoid duplicates, otherwise take both
267  Size offset = dates.back() == s.dates().front() ? 1 : 0;
268  isRegular.erase(isRegular.end() - offset,
269  isRegular.end()); // correct for superfluous flags from previous schedule
270  // add isRegular information, if available, otherwise assume irregular periods
271  if (s.hasIsRegular()) {
272  isRegular.insert(isRegular.end(), s.isRegular().begin(), s.isRegular().end());
273  } else {
274  for (Size ii = 0; ii < s.dates().size() - 1; ++ii)
275  isRegular.push_back(false);
276  }
277  if (i < schedules.size() - 1) {
278  // will be removed if next schedule's front date is matching last date of current schedule
279  isRegular.push_back(false);
280  }
281  // add the dates
282  dates.insert(dates.end(), s.dates().begin() + offset, s.dates().end());
283  }
284 
285  // 4) Build schedule
286  return Schedule(dates, hasCalendar && hasConsistentCalendar ? calendar : NullCalendar(),
287  hasConvention && hasConsistentConvention ? convention : Unadjusted,
288  hasTermConvention ? boost::optional<BusinessDayConvention>(termConvention) : boost::none,
289  hasTenor && hasConsistentTenor ? boost::optional<Period>(tenor) : boost::none,
290  hasRule && hasConsistentRule ? boost::optional<DateGeneration::Rule>(rule) : boost::none,
291  hasEndOfMonth && hasConsistentEndOfMonth ? boost::optional<bool>(endOfMonth) : boost::none,
292  isRegular);
293  }
294 }

◆ parseCorrelationFactor()

CorrelationFactor parseCorrelationFactor ( const std::string &  name)

Parse a correlation factor name. For example, a name like IR:EUR is parsed to a CorrelationFactor with type, name and index set to IR, EUR and 0 respectively. Note that the name is of the form type:name and the index is always set to 0 initially. The actual index is set separately.

Definition at line 58 of file correlationmatrix.cpp.

59

61  QL_REQUIRE(pos != string::npos, "Expected the factor to be of the form 'type:name'");
62 
63  CT::AssetType factorType = parseCamAssetType(name.substr(0, pos));
64  string factorName = name.substr(pos + 1);
65 
66  return { factorType, factorName, 0 };
67 }

◆ generateShiftedDateGrid()

boost::shared_ptr< DateGrid > generateShiftedDateGrid ( const boost::shared_ptr< DateGrid > &  dg,

)

306  {
307  DLOG("Building shifted date grid with shift of " << shift);
308  vector<Date> defaultDates = dg->dates();
309  vector<Date> closeOutDates;
310  for (auto d : defaultDates) {
311  Date closeOut = dg->calendar().adjust(d + shift);
312  closeOutDates.push_back(closeOut);
313  }

320  DLOG("Combining date grids");
321  vector<Date> combinedVec;
322  vector<Date> dates1 = dg1->dates();
323  vector<Date> dates2 = dg2->dates();
324  combinedVec.reserve(dates1.size() + dates2.size());

184  {
185 
186  // Should not attempt to add the same family name to the set if the provided mappings are one to one
187  set<string> familyNames;
188 
189  for (const auto& kv : onIndices) {
190  auto p = familyNames.insert(kv.second->familyName());
191  QL_REQUIRE(p.second, "Duplicate mapping for overnight index family " << *p.first << " not allowed");
192  }
193 
194  for (const auto& kv : iborIndices) {
195  auto p = familyNames.insert(kv.second->family());
196  QL_REQUIRE(p.second, "Duplicate mapping for ibor index family " << *p.first << " not allowed");
197  }
198 }
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ parseIborIndex()

boost::shared_ptr<IborIndex> ore::data::parseIborIndex ( const string &  s,
string &  tenor,
const Handle< YieldTermStructure > &  h,
const boost::shared_ptr< Convention > &  c 
)

Definition at line 239 of file indexparser.cpp.

240  {
241 
242  // Check the index string is of the required form before doing anything
243  vector<string> tokens;
244  split(tokens, s, boost::is_any_of("-"));
245  QL_REQUIRE(tokens.size() == 2 || tokens.size() == 3,
246  "Two or three tokens required in " << s << ": CCY-INDEX or CCY-INDEX-TERM");
247 
248  // Variables used below
249  string indexStem = tokens[0] + "-" + tokens[1];
250  if (tokens.size() == 3) {
251  tenor = tokens[2];
252  } else {
253  tenor = "";
254  }
255 
256  // if we have a convention given, set up the index using this convention, this overrides the parsing from
257  // hardcoded strings below if there is an overlap
258  if (c) {
259  QL_REQUIRE(c->id() == s, "ibor index convention id ('"
260  << c->id() << "') not matching ibor index string to parse ('" << s << "'");
261  Currency ccy = parseCurrency(tokens[0]);
262  if (auto conv = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<OvernightIndexConvention>(c)) {
263  QL_REQUIRE(tenor.empty(), "no tenor allowed for convention based overnight index ('" << s << "')");
264  return boost::make_shared<OvernightIndex>(tokens[0] + "-" + tokens[1], conv->settlementDays(), ccy,
265  parseCalendar(conv->fixingCalendar()),
266  parseDayCounter(conv->dayCounter()), h);
267 
268  } else if (auto conv = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<IborIndexConvention>(c)) {
269  QL_REQUIRE(!tenor.empty(), "no tenor given for convention based Ibor index ('" << s << "'");
270  return boost::make_shared<IborIndex>(tokens[0] + "-" + tokens[1], parsePeriod(tenor),
271  conv->settlementDays(), ccy, parseCalendar(conv->fixingCalendar()),
272  parseBusinessDayConvention(conv->businessDayConvention()),
273  conv->endOfMonth(), parseDayCounter(conv->dayCounter()), h);
274  } else {
275  QL_FAIL("invalid convention passed to parseIborIndex(): expected OvernightIndexConvention or "
276  "IborIndexConvention");
277  }
278  }
279 
280  // if we do not have a convention, look up the index in the hardcoded maps below
281 
282  // Map from our _unique internal name_ to an overnight index
283  static map<string, boost::shared_ptr<OvernightIndex>> onIndices = {
284  {"EUR-EONIA", boost::make_shared<Eonia>()}, {"EUR-ESTER", boost::make_shared<Ester>()},
285  //{"EUR-ESTR", boost::make_shared<Ester>()}, {"EUR-STR", boost::make_shared<Ester>()},
286  {"GBP-SONIA", boost::make_shared<Sonia>()}, {"JPY-TONAR", boost::make_shared<Tonar>()},
287  {"CHF-TOIS", boost::make_shared<CHFTois>()}, {"CHF-SARON", boost::make_shared<CHFSaron>()},
288  {"USD-FedFunds", boost::make_shared<FedFunds>()}, {"USD-SOFR", boost::make_shared<Sofr>()},
289  {"USD-Prime", boost::make_shared<PrimeIndex>()}, {"USD-AMERIBOR", boost::make_shared<USDAmeribor>()},
290  {"AUD-AONIA", boost::make_shared<Aonia>()},
291  {"CAD-CORRA", boost::make_shared<CORRA>()}, {"DKK-DKKOIS", boost::make_shared<DKKOis>()},
292  {"SEK-SIOR", boost::make_shared<SEKSior>()}, {"COP-IBR", boost::make_shared<COPIbr>()},
293  {"BRL-CDI", boost::make_shared<BRLCdi>()}, {"NOK-NOWA", boost::make_shared<Nowa>()},
294  {"CLP-CAMARA", boost::make_shared<CLPCamara>()}, {"NZD-OCR", boost::make_shared<Nzocr>()},
295  {"PLN-POLONIA", boost::make_shared<PLNPolonia>()}, {"INR-MIBOROIS", boost::make_shared<INRMiborOis>()},
296  {"GBP-BoEBase", boost::make_shared<BOEBaseRateIndex>()}, {"HKD-HONIA", boost::make_shared<HKDHonia>()},
297  {"SEK-STINA", boost::make_shared<SEKStina>()}, {"DKK-CITA", boost::make_shared<DKKCita>()}};
298 
299  // Map from our _unique internal name_ to an ibor index (the period does not matter here)XF
300  static map<string, boost::shared_ptr<IborIndexParser>> iborIndices = {
301  {"AUD-BBSW", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<AUDbbsw>>()},
302  {"AUD-LIBOR", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<AUDLibor>>()},

336  {"NZD-BKBM", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<NZDBKBM>>()},
337  {"TRY-TRLIBOR", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<TRLibor>>()},
338  {"TWD-TAIBOR", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<TWDTaibor>>()},
339  {"MYR-KLIBOR", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<MYRKlibor>>()},
340  {"KRW-CD", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<KRWCd>>()},
341  {"KRW-KORIBOR", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<KRWKoribor>>()},
342  {"ZAR-JIBAR", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<Jibar>>()},
343  {"RUB-MOSPRIME", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<RUBMosprime>>()},
344  {"THB-BIBOR", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<THBBibor>>()},
345  {"THB-THBFIX", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<THBFIX>>()},
346  {"PHP-PHIREF", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<PHPPhiref>>()},
347  {"RON-ROBOR", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<Robor>>()},
348  {"DEM-LIBOR", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<DEMLibor>>()},
349  {"CNY-REPOFIX", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<CNYRepoFix>>()}};
350 
351  // Check (once) that we have a one-to-one mapping
352  static bool checked = false;
353  if (!checked) {
354  checkOneToOne(onIndices, iborIndices);
355  checked = true;
356  }
357 
358  // Simple single case for USD-SIFMA (i.e. BMA)
359  if (indexStem == "USD-SIFMA") {
360  QL_REQUIRE(tenor.empty(), "A tenor is not allowed with USD-SIFMA as it is implied");
361  return boost::make_shared<BMAIndexWrapper>(boost::make_shared<BMAIndex>(h));
362  }
363 
364  // Overnight indices
365  auto onIt = onIndices.find(indexStem);
366  if (onIt != onIndices.end()) {
367  QL_REQUIRE(tenor.empty(),
368  "A tenor is not allowed with the overnight index " << indexStem << " as it is implied");
369  return onIt->second->clone(h);
370  }
371 
372  // Ibor indices with a tenor
373  auto it = iborIndices.find(indexStem);
374  if (it != iborIndices.end()) {
375  Period p = parsePeriod(tenor);
376  return it->second->build(p, h);
377  }
378 
379  // GENERIC indices
380  if (tokens[1] == "GENERIC") {
381  Period p = parsePeriod(tenor);
382  auto ccy = parseCurrency(tokens[0]);
383  return boost::make_shared<GenericIborIndex>(p, ccy, h);
384  }
385 
386  QL_FAIL("parseIborIndex \"" << s << "\" not recognized");
387 }

◆ parseCommodityIndex() [1/3]

boost::shared_ptr<QuantExt::CommodityIndex> ore::data::parseCommodityIndex ( const string &  name,
bool  hasPrefix,
const Calendar &  cal,
const Handle< PriceTermStructure > &  ts,
const Conventions &  conventions 
)

Definition at line 596 of file indexparser.cpp.

599  {
600 
601  // Whether we check for "COMM-" prefix depends on hasPrefix.
602  string commName = name;
603  if (hasPrefix) {
604  // Make sure the prefix is correct
605  string prefix = name.substr(0, 5);
606  QL_REQUIRE(prefix == "COMM-", "A commodity index string must start with 'COMM-' but got " << prefix);
607  commName = name.substr(5);
608  }
609 
610  // Now take the remainder of the string
611  // for spot indices, this should just be the commodity name (possibly containing hyphens)
612  // for future indices, this is of the form NAME-YYYY-MM or NAME-YYYY-MM-DD where NAME is the commodity name
613  // (possibly containing hyphens) and YYYY-MM(-DD) is the expiry date of the futures contract
614  Date expiry;
615 
616  // Check for form NAME-YYYY-MM-DD
617  if (commName.size() > 10) {
618  string test = commName.substr(commName.size() - 10);
619  if (boost::regex_match(test, boost::regex("\\d{4}-\\d{2}-\\d{2}"))) {
620  expiry = parseDate(test);
621  commName = commName.substr(0, commName.size() - test.size() - 1);
622  }
623  }
624 
625  // Check for form NAME-YYYY-MM if NAME-YYYY-MM-DD failed
626  if (expiry == Date() && commName.size() > 7) {
627  string test = commName.substr(commName.size() - 7);
628  if (boost::regex_match(test, boost::regex("\\d{4}-\\d{2}"))) {
629  expiry = parseDate(test + "-01");
630  commName = commName.substr(0, commName.size() - test.size() - 1);
631  }
632  }
633 
634  // Name to use when creating the index. This may be updated if we have a commodity future convention and IndexName
635  // is provided by the convention.
636  string indexName = commName;
637 
638  // Do we have a commodity future convention for the commodity.
639  pair<bool, boost::shared_ptr<Convention>> p = conventions.get(commName, Convention::Type::CommodityFuture);
640  boost::shared_ptr<CommodityFutureConvention> convention;
641  if (p.first) {
642 
643  convention = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CommodityFutureConvention>(p.second);
644 
645  if (!convention->indexName().empty())
646  indexName = convention->indexName();
647 
648  // If we have provided OffPeakPowerIndexData, we use that to construct the off peak power commodity index.
649  if (convention->offPeakPowerIndexData()) {
650 
651  const auto& oppIdxData = *convention->offPeakPowerIndexData();
652 
653  if (expiry == Date()) {
654  // If expiry is still not set use any date (off peak index is calendar daily)
655  expiry = Settings::instance().evaluationDate();
656  }
657  string suffix = "-" + to_string(expiry);
658 
659  auto offPeakIndex = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CommodityFuturesIndex>(parseCommodityIndex(
660  oppIdxData.offPeakIndex() + suffix, conventions, false));
661  auto peakIndex = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CommodityFuturesIndex>(parseCommodityIndex(
662  oppIdxData.peakIndex() + suffix, conventions, false));
663 
664  return boost::make_shared<OffPeakPowerIndex>(indexName, expiry, offPeakIndex, peakIndex,
665  oppIdxData.offPeakHours(), oppIdxData.peakCalendar(), ts);
666  }
667  }
668 
669  // Create and return the required future index
670  if (expiry != Date() || convention) {
671 
672  // If expiry is empty, just use any valid expiry.
673  if (expiry == Date()) {
674  ConventionsBasedFutureExpiry feCalc(*convention);
675  expiry = feCalc.nextExpiry();
676  }
677 
678  bool keepDays = convention && convention->contractFrequency() == Daily;
679 
680  Calendar cdr = cal;
681  if (convention && cdr == NullCalendar()) {
682  cdr = convention->calendar();
683  }
684 
685  return boost::make_shared<CommodityFuturesIndex>(indexName, expiry, cdr, keepDays, ts);
686 
687  } else {
688  return boost::make_shared<CommoditySpotIndex>(commName, cal, ts);
689  }
690 }
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ xccyCurveName()

std::string xccyCurveName ( const std::string &  ccyCode)

For a given currency code, ccyCode, return the internal name for the cross currency based yield curve.

For a given currency code, ccyCode, this function returns __XCCY__-ccyCode. This curve, if available, is currently used in special cases to allow for separate discount curves when discounting the cashflows on cross currency interest rate swaps.

Definition at line 31 of file marketdata.cpp.

31 { return xccyCurveNamePrefix + "-" + ccyCode; }
Here is the caller graph for this function:

const std::string &  configuration = Market::defaultConfiguration 
)

Attempt to return a yield curve from the market using the name generated by xccyCurveName(ccyCode). If no yield curve is available, return the discount curve for the given currency code, ccyCode.

◆ xccyYieldCurve() [2/2]

QuantLib::Handle< QuantLib::YieldTermStructure > xccyYieldCurve ( const boost::shared_ptr< Market > &  market,
const std::string &  ccyCode,
bool &  outXccyExists,
const std::string &  configuration = Market::defaultConfiguration 
)

Attempt to return a yield curve from the market using the name generated by xccyCurveName(ccyCode). If no yield curve is available, return the discount curve for the given currency code, ccyCode. The parameter outXccyExists is populated with true if a yield curve was found under xccyCurveName(ccyCode) and it is populated with false if there was no such yield curve.

Definition at line 39 of file marketdata.cpp.

40  {
41 
42  Handle<YieldTermStructure> curve;
43  string xccyCurve = xccyCurveName(ccyCode);
44  outXccyExists = true;
45  try {
46  curve = market->yieldCurve(xccyCurve, configuration);
47  } catch (const Error&) {
48  DLOG("Could not link " << ccyCode << " termstructure to cross currency yield curve " << xccyCurve
49  << " so just using " << ccyCode << " discount curve.");
50  curve = market->discountCurve(ccyCode, configuration);
51  outXccyExists = false;
52  }
53 
54  return curve;
55 }

1286  return os << "IMM";
1287  else if (t == FutureConvention::DateGenerationRule::FirstDayOfMonth)
1288  return os << "FirstDayOfMonth";
1289  else {
1290  QL_FAIL("Internal error: unknown FutureConvention::DateGenerationRule - check implementation of operator<< "
1291  "for this enum");
1292  }
1293 }
